title: Subscribe for Vikran Engineering Ltd IPO; Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi, Vikran Engineering Ltd Incorporated in 2008, headquarters in Thane, Maharashtra Vikran Engineering is specializing in turnkey infrastructure projects across power transmission, water supply, and railway electrification. It provides end-to-end services including design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning and has successfully completed or is executing critical projects like high-voltage substations up to 765 kV, eagle-eyed water systems under Jal Jeevan Mission, railway electrification, and metro infrastructure across 14–16 states, showcasing both breadth and depth of execution capability substations up to 400 kV, and power distribution networks. It has also executed 30,000 smart metering connections. Its clients in the government sector include NTPC, Power Grid Corporation of India, among others. As of June 30, 2025, the company has successfully completed 45 projects across 14 states with a total executed contract value of ₹19,199 million. As of the same date, the company had 44 ongoing projects across 16 states, aggregating orders of ₹51,202 million, of which the unexecuted order book stood at ₹24,424 million. Valuation and Outlook On the valuation front, based on annualized FY25 earnings, the company is seeking a P/E of 32.1 times, and a post-issue market capitalization of approximately Rs 25,017 million, making the issue appear fully priced. With a consistent track record of executing large-scale projects along with asset-light model for marquee government and public sector clients and PAN India presence, Vikran Engineering Limited is well-positioned to capitalize on opportunities in the high-growth infrastructure sector. Considering its scalability, financial strength, and sectoral tailwinds, we assign a ‘Subscribe for Long term’ rating for the IPO For all IPO report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Vikran Engineering -260825 - anand

summary_luhn: With a consistent track record of executing large-scale projects along with asset-light model for marquee government and public sector clients and PAN India presence, Vikran Engineering Limited is well-positioned to capitalize on opportunities in the high-growth infrastructure sector.
summary_lsa: With a consistent track record of executing large-scale projects along with asset-light model for marquee government and public sector clients and PAN India presence, Vikran Engineering Limited is well-positioned to capitalize on opportunities in the high-growth infrastructure sector.
summary_textrank: It provides end-to-end services including design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning and has successfully completed or is executing critical projects like high-voltage substations up to 765 kV, eagle-eyed water systems under Jal Jeevan Mission, railway electrification, and metro infrastructure across 14–16 states, showcasing both breadth and depth of execution capability substations up to 400 kV, and power distribution networks.

title: Sundaram Finance shares rise 2.06% in morning trade
content: Shares of Sundaram Finance gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 5,073 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,348.93 Crore, compared to Rs 1,951.60 Crore in June 2024, marking a significant increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 411.80 Crore, as against Rs 402.19 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 43.12 in June 2025, compared to Rs 39.46 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 8,485.63 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 7,267.12 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,812.81 Crore, up from Rs 1,422.43 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 170.53 in March 2025, compared to Rs 130.31 in March 2024. Here's a summary of Sundaram Finance's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,951.60 CroreRs 2,084.67 CroreRs 2,190.31 CroreRs 2,259.05 CroreRs 2,348.93 CroreNet ProfitRs 402.19 CroreRs 405.92 CroreRs 451.18 CroreRs 553.53 CroreRs 411.80 CroreEPS39.4639.5741.3350.1743.12The table illustrates the company's financial performance on a quarterly basis. Revenue has consistently increased from June 2024 to June 2025. Net profit has fluctuated, with a notable peak in March 2025. The following table shows Sundaram Finance's yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 5,247.67 CroreRs 5,108.37 CroreRs 5,476.15 CroreRs 7,267.12 CroreRs 8,485.63 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,002.05 CroreRs 1,066.62 CroreRs 1,271.75 CroreRs 1,422.43 CroreRs 1,812.81 CroreEPS105.74106.48119.59130.31170.53BVPS857.731,006.341,146.871,005.281,197.43ROE15.0713.3413.2912.9614.24Debt to Equity4.724.134.314.724.63The yearly data shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past five years. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained relatively stable. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 21 per share on May 26, 2025, with an effective date of July 9, 2025. Sundaram Finance also announced a minor correction in the Notice to the 72nd Annual General Meeting on July 21, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis from August 19, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock.

title: Sun Pharma shares fall 2.61%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Sun Pharma declined 2.61% to Rs 1,613.40 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50. Other top losers on Nifty 50 included Shriram Finance, Tata Steel, Dr Reddys Labs and Coal India. Quarterly Financial Performance: The consolidated quarterly revenue for Sun Pharma has shown an increasing trend. For the quarter ending June 2024, the revenue was Rs 12,652.75 Crore, which increased to Rs 13,291.39 Crore for September 2024, Rs 13,675.46 Crore for December 2024, and Rs 12,958.84 Crore for March 2025. The latest quarter ending June 2025, shows a revenue of Rs 13,851.40 Crore. Net profit also reflects fluctuations across the quarters. The net profit stood at Rs 2,871.25 Crore for June 2024, increased to Rs 3,030.67 Crore in September 2024, then slightly decreased to Rs 2,917.54 Crore in December 2024, and dropped to Rs 2,160.64 Crore in March 2025. However, it recovered to Rs 2,302.62 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) values align with the net profit trend, with values of Rs 11.80, Rs 12.70, Rs 12.10, Rs 9.00, and Rs 9.50 for the quarters from June 2024 to June 2025, respectively.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 12,652.75 CroreRs 13,291.39 CroreRs 13,675.46 CroreRs 12,958.84 CroreRs 13,851.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,871.25 CroreRs 3,030.67 CroreRs 2,917.54 CroreRs 2,160.64 CroreRs 2,302.62 CroreEPSRs 11.80Rs 12.70Rs 12.10Rs 9.00Rs 9.50Annual Financial Performance: The consolidated annual revenue for Sun Pharma has consistently increased over the years. In 2021, the revenue was Rs 33,498.14 Crore, which grew to Rs 38,654.49 Crore in 2022, Rs 43,885.68 Crore in 2023, Rs 48,496.85 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 52,578.44 Crore in 2025. The net profit also shows a strong growth trend. Starting from Rs 2,284.68 Crore in 2021, it increased to Rs 3,405.82 Crore in 2022, surged to Rs 8,560.84 Crore in 2023, further rose to Rs 9,648.44 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) reflects this growth, with values of Rs 12.10, Rs 13.60, Rs 35.30, Rs 39.90, and Rs 45.60 for the years 2021 through 2025, respectively. The BVPS (Book Value Per Share) has also increased steadily, from Rs 206.23 in 2021 to Rs 301.00 in 2025. The ROE (Return on Equity) remained relatively stable, fluctuating between 6.24% in 2021 and 15.13% in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained low, indicating a conservative capital structure, with values ranging from 0.07 in 2021 to 0.03 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 33,498.14 CroreRs 38,654.49 CroreRs 43,885.68 CroreRs 48,496.85 CroreRs 52,578.44 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,284.68 CroreRs 3,405.82 CroreRs 8,560.84 CroreRs 9,648.44 CroreRs 10,980.10 CroreEPSRs 12.10Rs 13.60Rs 35.30Rs 39.90Rs 45.60BVPSRs 206.23Rs 212.84Rs 247.22Rs 265.36Rs 301.00ROE6.24%6.81%15.13%15.04%15.13%Debt to Equity0.070.020.110.040.03Annual Income Statement: The sales for Sun Pharma have shown consistent growth over the past five years. Sales increased from Rs 33,498 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 52,578 Crore in March 2025. Other income has fluctuated, with a high of Rs 1,965 Crore in March 2025 and a low of Rs 634 Crore in March 2023. Total income increased from Rs 34,333 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 54,543 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure also increased, from Rs 31,392 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 40,559 Crore in March 2025. Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 2,940 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 13,983 Crore in March 2025. title: Max Healthcare Institute shares decline 2.32% amid volume surge
content: Shares of Max Healthcare Institute Limited experienced a decline of 2.32% to trade at Rs 1,193.10 in Tuesday's session. The stock witnessed high volume and a surge in trading activity during the session. Max Healthcare Institute Limited is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Overview: Max Healthcare Institute Limited's financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. title: UNO Minda share price hits all-time high; gains 0.71%
content: Shares of UNO Minda reached an all-time high of Rs 1,294.00 on the NSE in Tuesday's session. The stock is currently trading at Rs 1,292.50, a gain of 0.71% from its previous close, as of 10:50 am. UNO Minda is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Highlights: Here's a look at the consolidated quarterly and annual financial performance of UNO Minda: Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 3,817.51 CroreRs 4,244.79 CroreRs 4,183.99 CroreRs 4,528.32 CroreRs 4,489.09 CroreNet ProfitRs 174.10 CroreRs 217.73 CroreRs 213.89 CroreRs 234.57 CroreRs 261.77 CroreEPS3.474.274.054.635.06The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,489.09 Crore, compared to Rs 3,817.51 Crore in June 2024, marking a substantial increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 261.77 Crore, up from Rs 174.10 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased from 3.47 to 5.06. Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,373.74 CroreRs 8,313.00 CroreRs 11,236.49 CroreRs 14,030.89 CroreRs 16,774.61 CroreNet ProfitRs 224.27 CroreRs 347.48 CroreRs 600.30 CroreRs 739.28 CroreRs 840.29 CroreEPS7.7312.6411.4215.3616.42BVPS94.01131.8277.3991.7199.64ROE9.1810.3415.7217.8116.48Debt to Equity0.380.240.300.320.40The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 16,774.61 Crore, compared to Rs 6,373.74 Crore in 2021. The net profit for the same period was Rs 840.29 Crore, up from Rs 224.27 Crore in 2021. The EPS increased from 7.73 to 16.42. Debt to Equity ratio has increased from 0.38 to 0.40 from year 2021 to year 2025. Key highlights include:Analyst/Investor Meet: An in-person meeting at the Goldman Sachs Asia Leaders Conference 2025 in Hong Kong was announced on August 25, 2025.Allotment of NCDs: The company allotted 20,000 Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) on August 19, 2025.Credit Rating: ICRA revalidated the NCD rating, as announced on August 12, 2025.Dividends: UNO Minda has consistently distributed dividends to its shareholders. Recent dividend announcements include:Final Dividend: Announced on May 21, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025, amounting to Rs 1.50 per share (75%).Interim Dividend: Announced on February 6, 2025, with an effective date of February 12, 2025, amounting to Rs 0.75 per share (37.5%).Bonus Issues: UNO Minda has a history of issuing bonus shares:In 2022, a bonus ratio of 1:1 was announced on May 24, 2022, with an ex-bonus date of July 7, 2022.Prior to that, a bonus ratio of 2:1 was announced on May 22, 2018, with an ex-bonus date of July 11, 2018.Rights Issue: In 2020, UNO Minda announced a rights issue with the following details:Announced on June 29, 2020, with a rights ratio of 1:27.The ex-rights date was August 14, 2020, and the premium was Rs 248.Stock Splits: UNO Minda underwent a stock split in 2016:The announcement was made on June 28, 2016, with an ex-split date of September 12, 2016.The face value was reduced from Rs 10 to Rs 2.Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of today. UNO Minda's stock currently trades at Rs 1,292.50, marking a new peak and reflecting positive market dynamics.

title: Container Corporation of India shares fall 2.03%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Container Corporation of India declined by 2.03% to Rs 533.35 in Tuesday's trading session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This decline reflects very bearish sentiment, according to a recent Moneycontrol analysis. Financial Overview: Container Corporation of India has demonstrated steady financial performance. title: Vodafone Idea shares plummet 10% amid high volume; among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea were trading at Rs 6.67 on the NSE at 10:13 am, a steep decline of 9.86% from its previous close. The stock is currently among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150, experiencing a surge in trading volume. The high volume suggests a notable increase in trading activity for Vodafone Idea shares, coinciding with the significant price decrease.Financial SnapshotHere is a summary of Vodafone Idea's consolidated financial performance:Consolidated Quarterly ResultsKey financial figures for the recent quarters are as follows:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreRs 11,022.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 Crore-Rs 6,608.10 CroreEPS-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01-0.63The consolidated quarterly results reveal a fluctuating revenue trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 stood at Rs 10,508.30 Crore, increasing to Rs 11,022.50 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, representing a 4.9% increase. However, the company has consistently reported net losses across all quarters, with a net loss of Rs 6,608.10 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025.Consolidated Yearly ResultsThe consolidated yearly financial performance is detailed below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-15.40-9.83-8.43-6.41-4.01BVPS-13.30-19.29-15.28-20.78-9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-4.12-3.08-0.18-1.99-2.79The consolidated annual revenue has demonstrated a gradual increase, from Rs 41,952.20 Crore in 2021 to Rs 43,571.30 Crore in 2025, marking a 3.86% growth over the five-year period. Despite this revenue growth, the company has consistently reported net losses. The net loss for 2025 was Rs 27,385.20 Crore, compared to Rs 44,464.50 Crore in 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio for the year-ending March 2025 is -2.79.Income StatementThe following table presents an overview of the company's consolidated income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 43,571 CroreRs 42,651 CroreRs 42,177 CroreRs 38,515 CroreRs 41,952 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,020 CroreRs 113 CroreRs 311 CroreRs 129 CroreRs 174 CroreTotal IncomeRs 44,591 CroreRs 42,764 CroreRs 42,488 CroreRs 38,644 CroreRs 42,126 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 47,417 CroreRs 47,403 CroreRs 48,432 CroreRs 45,899 CroreRs 68,613 CroreEBITRs -2,825 CroreRs -4,638 CroreRs -5,943 CroreRs -7,254 CroreInterestRs 24,543 CroreRs 25,765 CroreRs 23,354 CroreRs 20,980 CroreRs 17,998 CroreTaxRs 15 CroreRs 828 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 11 CroreRs -20 CroreNet ProfitRs -27,385 CroreRs -31,232 CroreRs -29,301 CroreRs -28,246 CroreRs -44,464 CroreCorporate ActionsVodafone Idea Limited convened its Annual General Meeting on August 25, 2025. The transcript of the Analyst/Investor call, which took place on August 18, 2025, to discuss the company's financial results for the quarter-ending June 30, 2025, is publicly available. Additionally, an audio recording of the earnings call held on the same date is also accessible. Historically, Vodafone Idea has announced final dividends. For instance, on April 28, 2016, a final dividend of Rs 0.60 per share was declared. Similar announcements were made on April 28 of 2015, 2014, and 2013. On January 23, 2019, Vodafone Idea announced a rights issue with a rights ratio of 87:38. The face value was Rs 10, with a premium of Rs 3. The ex-rights date for this issue was March 29, 2019, and the record date was April 02, 2019. A Moneycontrol analysis conducted on August 20, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment surrounding the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 6.67, Vodafone Idea experienced a significant decline amid high trading volume, reflecting the bearish sentiment.

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls 1.11% in morning trade
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading lower in Tuesday's session. As of 10:30 am, the stock was priced at Rs 1,909.20 on the NSE, a decline of 1.11% from the previous close. Earlier in the trading session, the stock touched a high of Rs 1,925.80 and a low of Rs 1,900.10. Financial Overview The following tables provide a comprehensive look at Bharti Airtel's financial performance, covering both quarterly and annual results. These include key metrics such as revenue, net profit, and earnings per share (EPS). Consolidated Quarterly Results The consolidated quarterly results show a fluctuating but generally increasing trend in revenue. Revenue increased from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. Net profit saw a significant rise in December 2024 and March 2025 before decreasing to Rs 7,339.00 Crore in June 2025. EPS also reflects this volatility, peaking in December 2024 and then declining.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26Consolidated Yearly Results The consolidated yearly results demonstrate consistent growth in revenue, which increased from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. Net profit shows a recovery from a loss of Rs -23,327.90 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025. EPS has also improved significantly, from Rs -27.65 in 2021 to Rs 58.00 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet ProfitRs -23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13The annual income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 172,985 Crore, other income of Rs 1,573 Crore, and total income of Rs 174,558 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 118,109 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 56,449 Crore. Interest payments amounted to Rs 21,753 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 917 Crore. The net profit for the year stood at Rs 33,778 Crore. In comparison to the year ending March 2024, sales increased from Rs 149,982 Crore to Rs 172,985 Crore, demonstrating a growth in revenue. Similarly, net profit significantly increased from Rs 5,848 Crore to Rs 33,778 Crore. The quarterly income statement for June 2025 shows sales of Rs 49,462 Crore, other income of Rs 508 Crore, and total income of Rs 49,971 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 34,089 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 15,882 Crore. Interest payments amounted to Rs 5,460 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 3,082 Crore. The net profit for the quarter stood at Rs 7,339 Crore. In comparison to the quarter ending June 2024, sales increased from Rs 38,506 Crore to Rs 49,462 Crore, indicating a substantial growth in quarterly revenue. According to the cash flow statement, the net cash flow as of March 2025 is Rs 1,600 Crore compared to Rs 30 Crore in March 2024. Cash flow from operating activities is Rs 98,332 Crore, from investing activities is Rs -60,269 Crore, and from financing activities is Rs -36,533 Crore. The balance sheet shows that as of March 2025, the share capital is Rs 2,900 Crore and reserves & surplus is Rs 128,275 Crore. Current liabilities amount to Rs 180,440 Crore and other liabilities are Rs 202,744 Crore, with total liabilities reaching Rs 514,360 Crore. On the assets side, fixed assets are valued at Rs 347,769 Crore, current assets at Rs 67,588 Crore, and other assets at Rs 99,001 Crore, with total assets also at Rs 514,360 Crore. Key Financial Ratios Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel include a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of March 2025. The basic EPS is Rs 58.00 and diluted EPS is Rs 56.04 for the year ending March 2025. The book value per share is Rs 226.16. The company's dividend per share is Rs 16.00, with a face value of Rs 5. The return on net worth/equity is 25.58%. Corporate Announcements Bharti Airtel has made several announcements recently. On August 25, 2025, the company released a press release titled ''Nxtra by Airtel releases Sustainability Report for FY 2024-25'' through its subsidiary, Nxtra Data Limited. Nxtra Data Limited also released its Sustainability Report 2025. Additionally, the company made a disclosure under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 on August 13, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, effective July 18, 2025. Other recent dividends include Rs 8.00 per share (160%) announced on May 14, 2024, effective August 7, 2024, and Rs 4.00 per share (80%) announced on May 16, 2023, effective August 11, 2023. Bharti Airtel had a rights issue with an ex-rights date of September 27, 2021, where the rights ratio was 1:14, face value was Rs 5, and the premium was Rs 530. Another rights issue occurred on April 23, 2019, with a rights ratio of 19:67, face value of Rs 5, and premium of Rs 215. A stock split was announced on April 29, 2009, with an ex-split date of July 24, 2009, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 5. A Moneycontrol analysis as of August 19, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,909.20, Bharti Airtel reflects a dynamic interplay of market movements and corporate actions.

title: Eicher Motors shares rise 2%, among top gainers on Nifty 50 today
content: Shares of Eicher Motors gained 1.92% in Tuesday's trading session and was among the top gainers on Nifty 50 at 10:30 am. The stock is currently trading at Rs 6,105.50. Other stocks among the top gainers on Nifty 50 included Hero Motocorp (1.36%), Nestle (1.18%), HUL (0.82%), and Bajaj Auto (0.58%). title: Auto, metal, real estate stocks drop up to 2% on Trump tariff worries
content: The shares of auto, metal and real estate companies dropped in trade on August 26, after Donald Trump-led US administration issued a draft order over the implementation of additional 25 percent tariff on Indian imports, effectively from August 27 (Wednesday). The sharp drop in the share prices pushed the sectoral indices, as well as the overall market, down. Nifty Metal and Nifty Realty indices fell more than 1.2 percent and nearly 1.6 percent to hover around 9,319 and 902 respectively. Nifty Auto meanwhile was down over 0.6 percent in the morning. According to a draft notice released by US Department of Homeland Security, the additional tariffs will cover Indian products "that are entered for consumption, or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption, on or after 12:01 a.m. eastern daylight time on August 27, 2025". The notice cited "threats to the United States by the Government of the Russian Federation" as the reason for President Donald Trump's executive order dated August 6. The ties between New Delhi and Washington soured after Trump announced that he will hike the tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent, allegedly in response to New Delhi's continued purchases of Russian oil and defence equipment. Top losers on metal index: Several metal companies have strong export exposure to the US, and will likely be impacted by Trump's tariffs. On the metal index, Adani Enterprises shares were the top loser, dropping more than 2 percent to trade at Rs 2,253 apiece. Welspun Corp, Steel Authority of India (SAIL) and Tata Steel shares fell nearly 2 percent each. Hindalco Industries, National Aluminium Company (NALCO), Hindustan Copper, NMDC and JSW Steel shares fell more than 1 percent each, while Vedanta and Hindustan Zinc shares were down nearly 1 percent. Jindal Stainless Steel shares were trading in the red with marginal losses. Top losers on realty index: While real estate companies are mostly domestic market-oriented, Trump tariffs can inflate the cost of raw materials associated with the industry, which in turn may put pressure on the margins of these companies. On the realty index, heavyweight DLF was the top loser, dropping more than 2 percent to trade at Rs 755 apiece. Macrotech Developers (Lodha), Godrej Properties, Sobha and Oberoi Realty shares fell nearly 2 percent each. Prestige Estates, Raymond, Anant Raj, Phoenix and Brigade Enterprises shares fell around 1 percent each. Top losers on auto index: Several automakers and auto-parts makers derive major portion of their revenue from exports to US. While some auto and auto parts exports are exempt from the latest tariff change, the overall impact on the industry and uncertain trade rules may have pushed the stocks down. Samvardhana Motherson and Bharat Forge shares dropped more than 2 percent, leading losses on the auto index. Balkrishna Industries, MRF and Tube Investments of India shares fell around 1.5 percent each. TVS Motor, Ashok Leyland, Bosch and Maruti Suzuki shares were down up to 1 percent. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: Nifty Metal and Nifty Realty indices fell more than 1.2 percent and nearly 1.6 percent to hover around 9,319 and 902 respectively.
summary_luhn: The shares of auto, metal and real estate companies dropped in trade on August 26, after Donald Trump-led US administration issued a draft order over the implementation of additional 25 percent tariff on Indian imports, effectively from August 27 (Wednesday).
summary_lsa: Top losers on auto index: Several automakers and auto-parts makers derive major portion of their revenue from exports to US.
summary_textrank: While some auto and auto parts exports are exempt from the latest tariff change, the overall impact on the industry and uncertain trade rules may have pushed the stocks down.

A final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share (2400%) was announced on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 19.00 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10.00 per share were announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. Additionally, bonus issues were announced on September 30, 1991 (1:2), June 22, 1987 (1:1), June 22, 1983 (3:5), and June 22, 1979 (1:3). A stock split was announced on July 5, 2000, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 1, effective July 3, 2000. Hindustan Unilever continues to be a prominent player in the market.

Recent announcements include:Dividends: Infosys has announced a final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share (440%) with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 21.00 per share (420%) on October 29, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 20.00 per share (400%) and a special dividend of Rs 8.00 per share (160%) both effective May 31, 2024.Bonus Issues: The company has a history of bonus issues, with the most recent one on July 13, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. Other bonus issues were announced on April 24, 2015 (1:1), October 10, 2014 (1:1), April 14, 2006 (1:1), and April 13, 2004 (3:1). The ex-bonus date for the 2018 issue was September 4, 2018.Stock Splits: Infosys had a stock split on January 24, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 5.Additionally, on August 20, 2025, Infosys Finacle's Digital Banking SaaS suite on AWS Cloud was subscribed to by Uniting Financial Services, Australia. On August 13, 2025, Infosys entered into a joint venture agreement with Telstra Limited. With the stock currently priced at Rs 1,535.90, Infosys has shown a marginal increase in today's trading session.

title: Tube Investments of India shares fall 1.31% amid high volume, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Tube Investments of India Ltd declined by 1.31% to Rs 3,020.00 in today's session, experiencing high volume. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Tube Investments of India Ltd has demonstrated notable financial activity in its consolidated quarterly results. Here's a summary of the company's performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,577.92 CroreRs 4,924.55 CroreRs 4,812.22 CroreRs 5,149.96 CroreRs 5,309.06 CroreNet ProfitRs 313.80 CroreRs 299.30 CroreRs 280.22 CroreRs 158.22 CroreRs 303.28 CroreEPS11.6410.6910.012.4110.28The revenue for Tube Investments of India Ltd has shown a growth trend over the quarters. The revenue increased from Rs 4,577.92 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 5,309.06 Crore in June 2025. However, the net profit saw some fluctuations, with a dip in March 2025 to Rs 158.22 Crore before recovering to Rs 303.28 Crore in June 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also reflect these fluctuations, aligning with the net profit trends. Consolidated Yearly Performance: Tube Investments of India Ltd has also showcased strong financial performance on a consolidated yearly basis. Below are the key highlights:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,083.29 CroreRs 12,525.30 CroreRs 14,964.73 CroreRs 16,890.33 CroreRs 19,464.65 CroreNet ProfitRs 304.69 CroreRs 994.31 CroreRs 1,177.98 CroreRs 1,187.51 CroreRs 1,054.67 CroreEPS15.1339.8949.5062.1234.83BVPS130.07193.12256.63348.74286.08ROE13.1825.0324.1823.5412.17Debt to Equity0.610.260.160.150.08The company's revenue has consistently increased from Rs 6,083.29 Crore in 2021 to Rs 19,464.65 Crore in 2025. The net profit also saw significant growth over the years, although there was a slight decrease in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) has generally increased, reflecting the company's growing equity. Return on Equity (ROE) has seen fluctuations, while the debt-to-equity ratio has decreased, indicating a reduced reliance on debt financing. Although EBIT and Net Profit increased significantly from March 2021 to March 2024, there was a slight decrease in Net Profit in March 2025. title: Sun Pharma shares fall 2.59%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Sun Pharma declined 2.59% to Rs 1,613.80 in Tuesday's trading session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50. Other top losers on Nifty 50 included Adani Enterprises, Shriram Finance, Adani Ports and Dr Reddy's Labs at 10:00 am. Financial Highlights Sun Pharma's financial performance shows a fluctuating quarterly trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 13,851.40 Crore, compared to Rs 12,958.84 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Net profit for the same period was Rs 2,302.62 Crore and Rs 2,160.64 Crore respectively. The company’s EPS was Rs 9.50 for June 2025, down from Rs 11.80 in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for fiscal year 2025 was Rs 52,578.44 Crore, an increase from Rs 48,496.85 Crore in 2024. The annual net profit increased from Rs 9,648.44 Crore in 2024 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025. EPS also rose from Rs 39.90 in 2024 to Rs 45.60 in 2025. Key financial ratios show a P/E ratio of 38.04 and a P/B ratio of 5.77 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.03 as of the year-ending March 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)202133,498.142,284.6812.10202238,654.493,405.8213.60202343,885.688,560.8435.30202448,496.859,648.4439.90202552,578.4410,980.1045.60The company's revenue has increased by 56.95% in 2025 compared to 2021. title: Nestle shares rise 1.25%; stock among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Nestle gained 1.25 percent today, and were trading at Rs 1,167.40 at 10 am. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Other top gainers on Nifty 50 include Hindustan Unilever (HUL), TCS, Bajaj Auto and Infosys. Nestle Financial Overview Nestle's financial performance reveals key insights based on consolidated data. The quarterly revenue saw fluctuations, with a recent figure of Rs 5,096.16 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. Net profit for the same period stood at Rs 659.23 Crore, and the Earnings Per Share (EPS) was reported as Rs 6.71. Here is a detailed table of Nestle's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,813.95 CroreRs 5,104.00 CroreRs 4,779.73 CroreRs 5,503.88 CroreRs 5,096.16 CroreNet ProfitRs 746.60 CroreRs 903.21 CroreRs 695.82 CroreRs 885.88 CroreRs 659.23 CroreEPS7.749.337.149.066.71The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,096.16 crore compared to Rs 4,813.95 crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit stood at Rs 659.23 crore in the quarter-ending June 2025, lower than Rs 746.60 crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS also decreased from 7.74 in the quarter-ending June 2024 to 6.71 in the quarter-ending June 2025. Nestle's annual financial data provides further context. For the year-ending 2025, the revenue was Rs 20,201.56 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 3,231.54 Crore and an EPS of Rs 33.27. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) was Rs 41.59, and the Return on Equity (ROE) was 79.98. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.19. The following table summarizes Nestle's yearly financial performance:Heading20242025RevenueRs 24,393.89 CroreRs 20,201.56 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,932.84 CroreRs 3,231.54 CroreEPS40.7933.27BVPS34.6541.59ROE117.7179.98Debt to Equity0.010.19The revenue decreased by 17.23% from Rs 24,393.89 crore in 2024 to Rs 20,201.56 crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit also declined by 17.83%, from Rs 3,932.84 crore in 2024 to Rs 3,231.54 crore in 2025. The EPS decreased from 40.79 to 33.27, while the BVPS increased from 34.65 to 41.59. The ROE decreased from 117.71 to 79.98, and the debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.01 to 0.19. Corporate Actions Nestle India Limited has been actively involved in corporate actions. On August 11, 2025, the company informed the exchange regarding the allotment of 964,157,160 bonus equity shares with a face value of Re. 1 each. The company announced a bonus issue on June 26, 2025, with an existing and offered ratio of 1:1 and ex-date as August 08, 2025. Furthermore, dividends were declared, with the latest final dividend announced on April 24, 2025, at Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) with a record date of July 04, 2025. Conclusion Nestle's stock performance and financial health indicate a strong market presence, supported by recent gains and consistent financial activities.

title: Maruti Suzuki India shares rise to hit fresh all-time high on BSE today
content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki India rose to hit a new all-time high of Rs 14,499.05 on the BSE in the morning trading session, rising about 0.3% from the previous close. The stock was trading at Rs 14,485 at 10.20 am, up 0.2%. title: Tata Consultancy Services stock among top gainers on Nifty 50 today, share price gains
content: Tata Consultancy Services's stock is among the top gainers on Nifty 50, with the share price trading at Rs 3,146.00, an increase of 0.17% in Tuesday's session. At 10:10 am, the stock is showing positive movement compared to its previous close. Financial Overview: Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financials reveal consistent performance. The quarterly revenue has shown a steady trend, with June 2025 revenue at Rs 63,437 Crore compared to Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 12,819 Crore from Rs 12,105 Crore. The EPS also rose to Rs 35.27 in June 2025 from Rs 33.28 in June 2024. The annual figures demonstrate growth over the years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 255,324 Crore, up from Rs 240,893 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 48,797 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 46,099 Crore in March 2024. EPS also increased to Rs 134.19 in March 2025 compared to Rs 125.88 in March 2024. title: Rail Vikas Nigam shares fall 2.32% in early trade
content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam experienced a decline of 2.32% in early trading, with the stock price at Rs 314.20. This movement positions the stock among the losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 09:48 am, the stock reflected a negative trend compared to its previous close. Financial Snapshot: The following tables provide an overview of Rail Vikas Nigam's financial performance. Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,073.80 CroreRs 4,854.95 CroreRs 4,567.38 CroreRs 6,426.88 CroreRs 3,908.77 CroreNet ProfitRs 222.56 CroreRs 302.14 CroreRs 254.66 CroreRs 406.74 CroreRs 124.99 CroreEPS1.071.381.492.200.65The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,426.88 Crore, a significant increase compared to the quarter-ending June 2024, which was Rs 4,073.80 Crore. However, the revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 decreased to Rs 3,908.77 Crore. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 406.74 Crore, while the net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 124.99 Crore. Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 15,403.76 CroreRs 19,381.71 CroreRs 20,281.57 CroreRs 21,889.23 CroreRs 19,923.02 CroreNet ProfitRs 922.85 CroreRs 1,079.17 CroreRs 1,261.95 CroreRs 1,574.47 CroreRs 1,186.11 CroreEPS4.425.676.817.556.15BVPS26.7030.6835.1341.9545.90ROE16.5618.4819.3918.0013.38Debt to Equity1.021.030.870.680.56The annual revenue for 2024 was Rs 21,889.23 Crore, which decreased to Rs 19,923.02 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit saw a decrease from Rs 1,574.47 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,186.11 Crore in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has also decreased from 0.68 in 2024 to 0.56 in 2025. On August 13, 2025, the company announced the receipt of a Letter of Acceptance (LOA) from Southern Railway. On August 12, 2025, the audio recording of the conference call with investors/analysts/institutions was released. Additionally, there was a reshuffling of the shareholding pattern of Kinet Railway Solutions Private Limited, a Joint Venture Company of Rail Vikas Nigam Limited, announced on August 12, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.72 per share (17.2%) with an effective date of August 21, 2025. Previously, a final dividend of Rs 2.11 per share (21.1%) was announced with an effective date of September 23, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 26, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 314.20, Rail Vikas Nigam faces a challenging trading session amid broader market dynamics.

title: Oberoi Realty shares fall 2.01% in early trade
content: Shares of Oberoi Realty declined by 2.01% to Rs 1,639.10 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. title: Ola Electric Mobility shares rise 2.37% in early trade; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Ola Electric Mobility shares gained 2.37% to trade at Rs 49.72 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, with the increase reflecting a rise from its previous close. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the key financial performance indicators for Ola Electric Mobility:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,644.00 CroreRs 1,214.00 CroreRs 1,045.00 CroreRs 611.00 CroreRs 828.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 347.00 Crore-Rs 495.00 Crore-Rs 564.00 Crore-Rs 870.00 Crore-Rs 428.00 CroreEPS-0.95-1.20-1.28-1.97-0.97The quarterly revenue shows a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 828.00 Crore, compared to Rs 611.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit has been negative across all quarters, with a loss of Rs 428.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025 and a loss of Rs 870.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025.Heading2022202320242025RevenueRs 373.42 CroreRs 2,630.93 CroreRs 5,009.83 CroreRs 4,514.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 784.15 Crore-Rs 1,472.08 Crore-Rs 1,584.40 Crore-Rs 2,276.00 CroreEPS-2.23-3.91-4.35-5.48BVPS9.502.80-4.8811.66ROE-42.21-269.240.00-44.25Debt to Equity0.403.01-2.500.59The annual revenue for the year 2025 stood at Rs 4,514.00 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 5,009.83 Crore in 2024. title: Yes Bank share price falls 2.05% in early trade
content: Yes Bank shares experienced a decline of 2.05% in early trading, with the stock price falling to Rs 19.15. Yes Bank stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The quarterly financial performance of Yes Bank reveals the following trends in consolidated results: The revenue for Yes Bank has shown slight fluctuations over the past five quarters, with a marginal decrease from Rs 7,725 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 7,604 Crore in June 2025. Over the same period, the net profit increased steadily from Rs 516 Crore to Rs 808 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also rose consistently from 0.17 in June 2024 to 0.26 in June 2025, reflecting improved profitability. The consolidated yearly financials provide additional context on Yes Bank's performance: The annual revenue has increased steadily, from Rs 20,039 Crore in 2021 to Rs 30,918 Crore in 2025. The net profit has also seen a significant turnaround, from a loss of Rs 3,489 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 2,447 Crore in 2025. Key metrics such as EPS, BVPS, ROE, and NIM have also improved, indicating enhanced financial health. Additionally, the income statement provides a detailed breakdown of Yes Bank's annual financial activities, including interest earned, other income, total income, total expenditure, and various profit measures. For the year ending March 2025, interest earned stood at Rs 30,918 Crore, and net profit was Rs 2,447 Crore. The income statement also presents data related to Non-Performing Assets (NPAs), with Gross NPA at Rs 3,935 Crore and Net NPA at Rs 800 Crore as of March 2025. The balance sheet for the same period shows total liabilities of Rs 424,115 Crore and total assets of Rs 424,115 Crore, reflecting the bank's financial structure and stability. Corporate actions for Yes Bank include disclosures under Regulation 30 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, and intimations regarding shareholder communications and allotment of equity shares pursuant to stock options under YBL ESOS 2020 Scheme. The last split was announced on 2017-07-26, with old FV of 10 and new FV of 2 with exsplit date of 21 Sep, 2017.
summary_lexrank: The net profit has also seen a significant turnaround, from a loss of Rs 3,489 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 2,447 Crore in 2025.
summary_luhn: The quarterly financial performance of Yes Bank reveals the following trends in consolidated results: The revenue for Yes Bank has shown slight fluctuations over the past five quarters, with a marginal decrease from Rs 7,725 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 7,604 Crore in June 2025.
summary_lsa: Yes Bank shares experienced a decline of 2.05% in early trading, with the stock price falling to Rs 19.15.
summary_textrank: The quarterly financial performance of Yes Bank reveals the following trends in consolidated results: The revenue for Yes Bank has shown slight fluctuations over the past five quarters, with a marginal decrease from Rs 7,725 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 7,604 Crore in June 2025.

title: Dixon Technologies stock falls 2.30%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 in early trade
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies declined by 2.30% to Rs 16,627.00 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 at 9:48 am. Financial Snapshot: Dixon Technologies' consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 12,835.66 Crore, up from Rs 6,579.80 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 273.26 Crore, compared to Rs 132.26 Crore in the same quarter last year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 46.47 for June 2025, higher than Rs 23.35 in June 2024. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,239.10, Lodha Developers has seen a decline of 2% during pre-opening session.

title: DLF share price falls 2.20% in early trade
content: Shares of DLF declined by 2.20% to Rs 755.00 in early trade, as of about 9:41 am. The stock is a part of the NIFTY NEXT 50. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth over the years. The annual revenue has increased from Rs 5,414.06 Crore in 2021 to Rs 7,993.66 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise from Rs 477.29 Crore in 2021 to Rs 2,694.51 Crore in 2025. The EPS has increased from Rs 4.42 in 2021 to Rs 17.64 in 2025. title: Titan Company shares slip even as Bernstein initiates coverage with outperform call; 15% upside seen
content: Shares of Titan Company slipped almost a percent to Rs 3,627 in morning deals on Tuesday, August 26, even as Bernstein initiated coverage with an outperform rating on the stock, citing positive levers for growth. The drop comes amid a weak market mood after Donald Trump signalled an additional 25 percent tariff on India. The international brokerage has assigned a price target of Rs 4,200 per share. This implies an upside potential of 15 percent from the last closing price of Rs 3,651. The brokerage pointed to Titan’s strong legacy of delivering 23 percent EPS CAGR over the past two decades, while also highlighting that the stock currently trades at a five-year low valuation. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Despite challenges from higher gold prices, intensifying competition, and shifts in natural versus lab-grown diamond dynamics, Bernstein projects an 18 percent revenue CAGR and 25 percent EBIT CAGR between FY25 and FY28. The jeweller and watchmaker reported a 34 percent increase in standalone net profit at Rs 1,030 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The firm reported a standalone net profit of Rs 770 crore in the year-ago period. The firm's bottom line exceeded estimates as a Moneycontrol poll of five brokerages pegged it at Rs 893 crore. The firm's standalone revenue rose 21 percent to Rs 14,564 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 12,053 crore a year ago. The Tata group company said the watches business had an 'exceptional' quarter, recording a growth of 24 percent over Q1FY25, achieving a total income of Rs 1,273 crore. EBIT came in at Rs 287 crore, clocking a 22.6 percent margin for Q1FY26. At about 9:45 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 3,636, lower by 0.4 percent from the last close on the NSE. Titan Company shares have risen 12 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The firm's standalone revenue rose 21 percent to Rs 14,564 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 12,053 crore a year ago.
summary_luhn: The jeweller and watchmaker reported a 34 percent increase in standalone net profit at Rs 1,030 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025.
summary_lsa: The drop comes amid a weak market mood after Donald Trump signalled an additional 25 percent tariff on India.
summary_textrank: The Tata group company said the watches business had an 'exceptional' quarter, recording a growth of 24 percent over Q1FY25, achieving a total income of Rs 1,273 crore.

title: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries shares fall 2.29% in early trade
content: Shares of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries declined by 2.29% to Rs 1,618.70 in Tuesday's early trading session. A Moneycontrol analysis as of August 21, 2025 reflects a bearish sentiment on Sun Pharma stock. Financial Highlights Sun Pharmaceutical Industries' financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 52,578.44 Crore, compared to Rs 48,496.85 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Net profit also increased from Rs 9,648.44 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in March 2025. The quarterly performance also reveals a positive trend. Revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 13,851.40 Crore, up from Rs 12,652.75 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,302.62 Crore, slightly down from Rs 2,871.25 Crore in June 2024. Key financial data is summarized below:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202133,498.142,284.6812.10206.236.240.07202238,654.493,405.8213.60212.846.810.02202343,885.688,560.8435.30247.2215.130.11202448,496.859,648.4439.90265.3615.040.04202552,578.4410,980.1045.60301.0015.130.03Sun Pharmaceutical Industries has demonstrated consistent growth in key financial metrics from 2021 to 2025. Revenue increased from Rs 33,498.14 Crore in 2021 to Rs 52,578.44 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, from Rs 2,284.68 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have increased from Rs 12.10 in 2021 to Rs 45.60 in 2025, and the book value per share (BVPS) has grown from Rs 206.23 to Rs 301.00 over the same period. The company's Return on Equity (ROE) has remained relatively stable at around 15% in recent years, and the debt-to-equity ratio has been maintained at a low level, indicating a strong financial position. Quarterly PerformanceQuarterSales (Rs Crore)Other Income (Rs Crore)Total Income (Rs Crore)Total Expenditure (Rs Crore)EBIT (Rs Crore)Interest (Rs Crore)Tax (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)Jun 202513,85146414,31511,0683,247748702,302Mar 202512,95861213,57110,2683,303491,0932,160Dec 202413,67546514,14110,6133,527515582,917Sep 202413,29135413,6459,9783,667695673,030Jun 202412,65253213,1859,7003,485615522,871The quarterly data shows revenue increasing from Rs 12,652 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 13,851 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, net profit varied across the quarters, with the highest being Rs 3,030 Crore in September 2024 and the lowest at Rs 2,160 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure has generally remained stable, contributing to fluctuations in net profit. Corporate Actions Sun Pharmaceutical Industries has announced several corporate actions, including analyst/investor meetings. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (550%) on May 22, 2025, which was effective from July 7, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 10.50 per share (1050%) was announced on January 16, 2025, effective from February 6, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on July 29, 2013, and another 1:1 bonus on May 27, 2004. A 2:1 bonus was issued on March 6, 2000. Furthermore, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries has executed stock splits, including a split from a face value of Rs 5 to Rs 1 on November 25, 2010, and a split from Rs 10 to Rs 5 on January 13, 2003. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,618.70, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries reflects a bearish trend amid overall positive financial performance and active corporate actions.

title: KPR Mill shares fall 2.43%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KPR Mill declined 2.43% to Rs 995.70 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. KPR Mill's consolidated financial performance shows consistent revenue and net profit growth. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,766.27 Crore, compared to Rs 1,609.66 Crore in June 2024. title: Vodafone Idea shares slumps 9% after govt clarifies no fresh discussion on AGR relief
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea is witnessing a serious bout of profit booking, down over 9 percent in early trade on August 26, taking Indus Towers' shares along with it, as investors likely offloaded positions after clarification from the Telecom Ministry on the company's AGR dues. Minister of State for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar had told Moneycontrol on August 25 that there is no plan under consideration to extend further relief other than what has been already extended. “...we have recently converted a lot of their debt into equity. Government has done whatever we thought we could do and at this time we don’t have any discussion or plan to change other than what we have done,” the minister said. Any additional relief for Vodafone Idea (Vi) on its adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues will be decided collectively by the Union Cabinet, involving the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO), Finance Ministry, Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia and the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), the minister added. Shares of Indus Tower are down 3.5 percent in early trade on August 26, but are flat on a YTD basis. Shares of Vodafone Idea are down over 15 percent on a YTD basis. Last week, a news report had suggested that the DoT has proposed “multiple relief options” to the PMO, including a fresh two-year moratorium on AGR payments, smaller annual instalments, and waivers on penalties and interest. Asked if the PMO had received a proposal from DoT on extending relief to the operator, Sekhar replied: “not that we know of.” On the question of survival, the minister responded, “That is not up to me to decide… every company, all the companies, are continuously reaching out for various reasons, they will also be continuously reaching. But at this time, the discussion — there is nothing that we have planned.” Vi had previously urged DoT to treat the Rs 17,213 crore (principal calculated till FY19) as final, and waive off the entire interest and penalty on AGR dues. Akshaya Moondra, the CEO of Vodafone Idea had told analysts during an investor call earlier this month that the company is entirely focusing on investing in the business. "...whatever capital is available to the Company, the focus is not in trying to do anything with the government holding. The focus will be in using any funding and cash generation for investments, which will give the best returns for the business." The telecom player is engaged with banks for funding, which have started moving forward. The banks are currently looking for some clarity on the AGR front, Voda Idea has said, hence the company is engaged with the government. "In the past, we have always seen that government has been supportive. You look at 2019 deferment of spectrum instalments, 2021 Reforms Package, 2023 conversion of government dues to equity, 2025 again, conversion of government dues to equity. Generally, these actions have happened. Generally, they happen closer to the time when it is essentially needed. Our request to the government has been that let us resolve this earlier than before the deadline of March, so thatbanks get clarity and we can proceed with bank funding," Akshaya Moondra had told investors during the June quarter earnings call.
summary_lexrank: Government has done whatever we thought we could do and at this time we don’t have any discussion or plan to change other than what we have done,” the minister said.
summary_luhn: Asked if the PMO had received a proposal from DoT on extending relief to the operator, Sekhar replied: “not that we know of.” On the question of survival, the minister responded, “That is not up to me to decide… every company, all the companies, are continuously reaching out for various reasons, they will also be continuously reaching.
summary_lsa: Minister of State for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar had told Moneycontrol on August 25 that there is no plan under consideration to extend further relief other than what has been already extended.
summary_textrank: Asked if the PMO had received a proposal from DoT on extending relief to the operator, Sekhar replied: “not that we know of.” On the question of survival, the minister responded, “That is not up to me to decide… every company, all the companies, are continuously reaching out for various reasons, they will also be continuously reaching.

title: Indus Towers share price falls 2.54% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Indus Towers declined 2.54% to Rs 345.75 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 09:35 am, the stock was trading lower. Financial Snapshot The following tables provide a summary of Indus Towers' key financial data. title: BSE Limited share price falls 2.44% in early trade
content: Shares of BSE Limited declined by 2.44% to Rs 2,234.80 in early trade. At 9:35 am, the stock showed a significant dip compared to its previous close, reflecting early market volatility. BSE Limited is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Performance: The consolidated financial performance of BSE Limited reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: For the quarter-ending June 2025, revenue stood at Rs 1,037.45 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 670.64 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 521.88 Crore, compared to Rs 241.56 Crore in the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 13.09. Annual Results: The annual revenue for March 2025 was Rs 3,212.04 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 1,592.50 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw substantial growth, reaching Rs 1,234.47 Crore, up from Rs 699.84 Crore. EPS increased to Rs 96.55 in March 2025 from Rs 56.66 in March 2024. The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly income statement:Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 1,037 CroreRs 916 CroreRs 831 CroreRs 813 CroreRs 670 CroreOther IncomeRs 7 CroreRs 9 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 5 CroreRs 3 CroreTotal IncomeRs 1,044 CroreRs 926 CroreRs 835 CroreRs 818 CroreRs 674 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 359 CroreRs 282 CroreRs 567 CroreRs 386 CroreRs 347 CroreEBITRs 697 CroreRs 644 CroreRs 268 CroreRs 432 CroreRs 326 CroreInterestRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreTaxRs 175 CroreRs 166 CroreRs 69 CroreRs 110 CroreRs 85 CroreNet ProfitRs 521 CroreRs 478 CroreRs 198 CroreRs 321 CroreRs 241 CroreThe following table summarizes the consolidated yearly income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 3,212 CroreRs 1,592 CroreRs 924 CroreRs 743 CroreRs 501 CroreOther IncomeRs 24 CroreRs 25 CroreRs 29 CroreRs 120 CroreRs 153 CroreTotal IncomeRs 3,236 CroreRs 1,617 CroreRs 953 CroreRs 863 CroreRs 654 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 1,570 CroreRs 679 CroreRs 678 CroreRs 578 CroreRs 534 CroreEBITRs 1,665 CroreRs 938 CroreRs 275 CroreRs 285 CroreRs 119 CroreInterestRs 0 CroreRs 15 CroreRs 27 CroreRs 22 CroreRs 10 CroreTaxRs 431 CroreRs 223 CroreRs 91 CroreRs 82 CroreRs 10 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,234 CroreRs 699 CroreRs 156 CroreRs 180 CroreRs 98 CroreThe company's revenue increased by approximately 101.72 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. Balance Sheet: As of March 2025, the share capital stood at Rs 27 Crore, with reserves and surplus at Rs 4,396 Crore. The total liabilities amounted to Rs 10,341 Crore, and total assets were also valued at Rs 10,341 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow from operating activities for March 2025 was Rs 414 Crore. The net cash flow was Rs -550 Crore. Ratios: Key financial ratios for BSE Limited show a basic EPS of Rs 96.55 and diluted EPS of Rs 96.55. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 326.84 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: BSE Limited announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 2:1, with the ex-bonus date as May 23, 2025. The company also announced dividends, including a final dividend of Rs 18 per share and a special dividend of Rs 5 per share to commemorate the 150th year of BSE Ltd, both effective from May 14, 2025. Shares of BSE Limited witnessed a decline in the early trading session, influenced by overall market dynamics and recent financial announcements.

title: Colgate, Jindal Stainless stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 9:30 am on Tuesday, several stocks demonstrated positive movement on the Nifty Midcap 150. Among the top gainers were Colgate, Jindal Stainless, Sundaram Fin, Sun TV Network and Hitachi Energy. Colgate's shares led the gains, trading at Rs 2,318.40, a 1.56% increase. Jindal Stainless followed, with its shares at Rs 808.25, up 1.48%. Sundaram Fin shares traded at Rs 5,019.70, reflecting a 0.99% rise. Sun TV Network shares were at Rs 570.60, a 0.35% increase, while Hitachi Energy shares traded at Rs 19,510.00, marking a 0.31% gain. Here's a detailed financial overview of the top three gainers: Colgate The company has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the years. Key financial metrics are as follows:Heading20062007200820092010RevenueRs 1,129.30 CroreRs 1,298.72 CroreRs 1,475.17 CroreRs 1,751.20 CroreRs 2,014.84 CroreNet ProfitRs 140.04 CroreRs 148.40 CroreRs 236.68 CroreRs 288.23 CroreRs 435.61 CroreEPS10.3010.9117.3421.0131.92BVPS20.6420.4712.6016.1024.28ROE49.8853.30140.92132.75131.45Debt to Equity0.020.020.030.020.01The standalone annual income statement for Colgate shows consistent performance. title: Vodafone Idea, Max Healthcare stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Several stocks experienced declines in early trading today, with Vodafone Idea leading the downturn on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 09:30 am, Vodafone Idea's shares were trading at Rs 6.94, a 6.22% drop from its previous close, making it the top loser on the index. Other notable decliners included Max Healthcare, KPR Mill, Mazagon Dock, and Bharat Forge. Vodafone Idea Limited informed the exchange about the proceedings of the Annual General Meeting held on August 25, 2025. title: Max Healthcare Institute shares fall 2.06% in early trade
content: Shares of Max Healthcare Institute Limited declined by 2.06% to Rs 1,196.20 in early trade. At 09:28 am, the stock reflected a negative trend on the exchanges. On the financial front, the consolidated quarterly revenue for Max Healthcare Institute has shown consistent growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 1,542.95 Crore, which increased to Rs 1,707.46 Crore for September 2024, Rs 1,868.31 Crore for December 2024, and further to Rs 1,909.74 Crore for March 2025. The latest quarter-ending June 2025 saw revenue reaching Rs 2,027.57 Crore. Net profit also experienced fluctuations across the quarters. It stood at Rs 236.27 Crore for June 2024, increased to Rs 281.81 Crore in September 2024, then slightly decreased to Rs 238.80 Crore in December 2024, before rising again to Rs 319.00 Crore in March 2025. For the quarter-ending June 2025, the net profit was Rs 307.97 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, with values of Rs 2.43 for June 2024, Rs 2.90 for September 2024, Rs 2.46 for December 2024, Rs 3.28 for March 2025, and Rs 3.17 for June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,542.95 CroreRs 1,707.46 CroreRs 1,868.31 CroreRs 1,909.74 CroreRs 2,027.57 CroreNet ProfitRs 236.27 CroreRs 281.81 CroreRs 238.80 CroreRs 319.00 CroreRs 307.97 CroreEPS2.432.902.463.283.17The consolidated yearly financials reveal a strong growth trajectory. Revenue increased from Rs 2,504.67 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,931.46 Crore in 2022, Rs 4,562.60 Crore in 2023, Rs 5,406.02 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 7,028.46 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also shown significant improvement, turning from a loss of Rs -114.50 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 605.05 Crore in 2022, Rs 1,103.51 Crore in 2023, Rs 1,057.64 Crore in 2024, and Rs 1,075.88 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the Earnings per Share (EPS) has grown from Rs -1.59 in 2021 to Rs 6.25 in 2022, Rs 11.38 in 2023, Rs 10.89 in 2024, and Rs 11.07 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,504.67 CroreRs 3,931.46 CroreRs 4,562.60 CroreRs 5,406.02 CroreRs 7,028.46 CroreNet ProfitRs -114.50 CroreRs 605.05 CroreRs 1,103.51 CroreRs 1,057.64 CroreRs 1,075.88 CroreEPS-1.596.2511.3810.8911.07BVPS58.3764.7976.3186.5196.50ROE-2.439.6314.8912.5711.46Debt to Equity0.160.120.080.140.27The annual income statement shows consistent growth in sales, from Rs 2,504 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 7,028 Crore in March 2025. Total income also increased significantly, from Rs 2,619 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 7,184 Crore in March 2025. The company's total expenditure rose from Rs 2,508 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 5,612 Crore in March 2025. Consequently, the Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 110 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 1,571 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has also seen a substantial rise, from a loss of Rs -114 Crore in March 2021 to a profit of Rs 1,075 Crore in March 2025.Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 7,028 CroreRs 5,406 CroreRs 4,562 CroreRs 3,931 CroreRs 2,504 CroreOther IncomeRs 155 CroreRs 178 CroreRs 139 CroreRs 127 CroreRs 114 CroreTotal IncomeRs 7,184 CroreRs 5,584 CroreRs 4,701 CroreRs 4,058 CroreRs 2,619 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 5,612 CroreRs 4,158 CroreRs 3,554 CroreRs 3,219 CroreRs 2,508 CroreEBITRs 1,571 CroreRs 1,425 CroreRs 1,147 CroreRs 839 CroreRs 110 CroreInterestRs 165 CroreRs 59 CroreRs 83 CroreRs 100 CroreRs 179 CroreTaxRs 330 CroreRs 307 CroreRs -39 CroreRs 133 CroreRs 45 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,075 CroreRs 1,057 CroreRs 1,103 CroreRs 605 CroreRs -114 CroreThe company has announced several corporate actions. The transcript of the earnings call held on August 14, 2025, was announced under Regulation 30 (LODR). Additionally, an agreement was made to lease for establishing a 130-bedded built-to-suit hospital at Dehradun, Uttarakhand. A presentation on earnings update for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, was also released. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (15%) with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share was announced on May 22, 2024, with an effective date of August 23, 2024. The company’s cash flow from operating activities has generally increased over the years, from Rs 117 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 1,459 Crore in March 2025. However, net cash flow showed fluctuations, with a net outflow of Rs -318 Crore in March 2025. The balance sheet shows that total assets have grown from Rs 8,544 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 15,214 Crore in March 2025, reflecting overall growth and expansion. Fixed assets have nearly doubled from Rs 4,108 Crore to Rs 8,922 Crore during the same period. Key financial ratios for Max Healthcare Institute as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 11.07 and a diluted EPS of Rs 11.01. The book value per share (excluding revaluation reserve) stood at Rs 96.50. The company’s dividend per share was Rs 1.50, with a face value of Rs 10. The debt to equity ratio was 0.27, and the interest coverage ratio was 12.15. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,196.20, Max Healthcare Institute Limited experienced a decline of 2.06% in early trading.

title: Positive contributors to Nifty 50: HUL, ITC, M&M among top stocks on the index today
content: Positive momentum was observed in the Nifty 50 index during Tuesday's trading session, with several stocks contributing significantly to the index's gains. As of 9:25 am, key contributors included Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ITC, Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M), Bajaj Auto, and Titan Company. HUL shares showed a gain of 1.81%, reaching a price of Rs 2,639.30. ITC followed with a 1.38% increase, trading at Rs 399.90. M&M also saw a notable rise of 1.14%, with its shares priced at Rs 3,402.10. Other significant contributors to the Nifty 50 included Bajaj Auto, up 0.78% to Rs 8,770.00, and Titan Company, which increased by 0.63% to Rs 3,653.90. Hero Motocorp recorded a smaller gain of 0.47%, trading at Rs 5,076.60, while Infosys shares rose by 0.4% to Rs 1,532.50. Here's a detailed look into the financial performance and corporate actions of these key companies:Hindustan Unilever (HUL)HUL's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514 Crore, up from Rs 15,707 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 2,769 Crore from Rs 2,614 Crore. The annual figures reveal a steady increase in revenue, from Rs 47,028 Crore in 2021 to Rs 63,121 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose consistently, reaching Rs 10,679 Crore in 2025. Key financial ratios include a basic EPS of Rs 45.32 and a book value per share of Rs 210.22 as of March 2025. The company's return on equity (ROE) stood at 21.55% for the year. title: Sensex tumbles 600 pts, Nifty below 24,800 as US notifies India of additional tariffs; bank, pharma, metal stocks lead decline
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex fell 0.7 percent each in morning trade on August 26, weighed down by the additional 25% duties on Indian goods scheduled to take effect on August 27. Bank, metal and pharma stocks were major laggards while the mid and smallcaps also mirrored weak trends in early trade. At 10:40 am, the Sensex was down 612.85 points or 0.75 percent at 81,023.06, and the Nifty was down 182.50 points or 0.73 percent at 24,785.25. About 1,028 shares advanced, 2,344 shares declined, and 133 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Earlier this month, Trump said the US would raise tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent from 25 percent, citing New Delhi’s purchases of Russian oil. The move is intended to curb India’s energy trade with Moscow and increase pressure on Russia to halt its war in Ukraine. "Despite muted earnings growth and challenges such as high tariffs, Indian equities have held firm, making the market the most expensive globally. While foreign investors have remained steady sellers, strong domestic institutional inflows have more than offset the outflows, keeping sentiment buoyant. With liquidity emerging as the key driver of this resilience—and flows expected to stay strong—analysts believe a sharp correction is unlikely, and elevated valuations could persist," V K Vijayakumar of Geojit Investments Ltd said. Among individual stocks, Sai Life Sciences slipped as much as 4 percent after private equity firm TPG Asia offloaded its entire 15.2 percent holding in the Hyderabad-based CRDMO through block deals, CNBC TV-18 reported. The sale, estimated at nearly Rs 2,810 crore, involves about 3.16 crore shares and carries a floor price of Rs 874 per share, roughly at a 3.5 percent discount from the previous close of Rs 906 per share. Titan shares slipped due to a weak market mood even as Bernstein initiated coverage with an “outperform” rating and a target price of Rs 4,200, citing the company’s strong positioning to benefit from rising formalisation and evolving consumer preferences in India. The brokerage highlighted Titan’s track record of delivering a 23 percent EPS CAGR over the past two decades and noted that the stock is trading at a five-year low valuation. Reliance Industries shares were in focus after UBS resumed coverage on the stock with a “buy” call and a price target of Rs 1,750, implying a 24 percent upside from Monday’s close. The brokerage said RIL is well placed for a re-rating on the back of its value-unlocking prospects and described the conglomerate as a key player shaping India’s digital and new energy future. Technical View With Nifty failing to display directional strength, the index now clings to its crucial support at 24,800. The broader setup between the swing high of 25,150 and swing low of 24,850 indicates limited upside and a prolonged consolidation phase. Renewed call writing at higher strikes, coupled with sustained put additions at similar levels, further validates the sideways structure. Unless the index decisively clears 25,150, upward momentum is likely to remain capped. On the downside, sustaining above 24,800 is critical to prevent deeper corrections. For now, a “sell on rise” approach appears prudent, with traders awaiting a clear breakout above 25,100 or a breakdown below 24,800 for the next directional move. Ahead of the key tariff announcement on the 27th, the market is likely to witness sideways-to-volatile sessions. HUL, Bajaj Auto, TCS and Infosys were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Tata Steel, Dr Reddy's, ICICI Bank, Bharat Electronics, and Hindalco. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The brokerage said RIL is well placed for a re-rating on the back of its value-unlocking prospects and described the conglomerate as a key player shaping India’s digital and new energy future.
summary_luhn: Reliance Industries shares were in focus after UBS resumed coverage on the stock with a “buy” call and a price target of Rs 1,750, implying a 24 percent upside from Monday’s close.
summary_lsa: Titan shares slipped due to a weak market mood even as Bernstein initiated coverage with an “outperform” rating and a target price of Rs 4,200, citing the company’s strong positioning to benefit from rising formalisation and evolving consumer preferences in India.
summary_textrank: The brokerage said RIL is well placed for a re-rating on the back of its value-unlocking prospects and described the conglomerate as a key player shaping India’s digital and new energy future.

title: Zydus Lifesciences shares fall 2.78% in early trade
content: Shares of Zydus Lifesciences declined by 2.78% to Rs 994.70 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Key financial figures reveal the consolidated quarterly performance of Zydus Lifesciences. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 6,573.70 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 6,207.50 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 1,486.60 Crore, up from Rs 1,463.60 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. title: Jindal Stainless shares rise 2.02% in early trade
content: Shares of Jindal Stainless gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 812.55 in early trade. The stock demonstrated positive movement in today's session. On the financial front, Jindal Stainless has shown steady growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 10,207.14 Crore, up from Rs 9,429.76 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 728.32 Crore, compared to Rs 647.50 Crore in the previous year. Here is a summary of the company's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 9,429.76 CroreRs 9,776.83 CroreRs 9,907.30 CroreRs 10,198.32 CroreRs 10,207.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 647.50 CroreRs 609.42 CroreRs 668.78 CroreRs 617.94 CroreRs 728.32 CroreEPS7.877.427.957.188.67The company's yearly financial performance also reflects growth. Consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 39,312.21 Crore from Rs 38,562.47 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease, from Rs 2,640.35 Crore in 2024 to Rs 2,543.42 Crore in 2025. Below is an overview of the company's yearly financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,188.46 CroreRs 21,223.40 CroreRs 35,697.03 CroreRs 38,562.47 CroreRs 39,312.21 CroreNet ProfitRs 414.25 CroreRs 1,806.44 CroreRs 1,973.87 CroreRs 2,640.35 CroreRs 2,543.42 CroreEPS8.6037.8125.6832.9530.42BVPS66.0599.46145.33174.56202.61ROE13.0736.2717.7218.8915.01Debt to Equity0.970.600.320.410.38The Income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 39,312 Crore compared to Rs 38,562 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 290 Crore and total income at Rs 39,603 Crore for year ending March 2025. The total expenditure was Rs 35,608 Crore and EBIT stood at Rs 3,994 Crore for the same period. Interest paid was Rs 611 Crore and tax was Rs 839 Crore. The net profit was Rs 2,543 Crore. The income statement for the quarter ending June 2025 shows sales of Rs 10,207 Crore compared to Rs 9,429 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. Other income stood at Rs 68 Crore and total income at Rs 10,276 Crore for quarter ending June 2025. The total expenditure was Rs 9,149 Crore and EBIT stood at Rs 1,126 Crore for the same period. Interest paid was Rs 144 Crore and tax was Rs 254 Crore. The net profit was Rs 728 Crore. The company’s cash flow from operating activities was Rs 4,718 Crore for the year ending March 2025. Investing activities resulted in an outflow of Rs 3,438 Crore and financing activities led to an outflow of Rs 1,882 Crore. The net cash flow for the year was a negative Rs 600 Crore. Analyzing the balance sheet, the share capital remained constant at Rs 164 Crore between March 2024 and March 2025. Reserves and surplus increased from Rs 14,193 Crore to Rs 16,523 Crore. Total assets and total liabilities both stood at Rs 36,158 Crore as of March 2025. Key financial ratios for Jindal Stainless as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 30.42 and a diluted EPS of Rs 30.41. The book value per share was Rs 202.61. The company's debt to equity ratio stood at 0.38, and the interest coverage ratio was 8.11. Jindal Stainless announced a final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (100%) with an effective date of August 22, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 1.00 per share (50%) was announced on January 29, 2025, and was effective from February 7, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of today. Shares of Jindal Stainless gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 812.55 in early trade, demonstrating positive movement in today's session.

title: Bharat Forge shares fall 2.14% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
