title: Asian Paints share price declines 1.04%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Asian Paints were among the top losers on the Nifty 50, declining by 1.04% to Rs 2,478.40 in Monday's session. Other top losers on the Nifty 50 included Apollo Hospital, Nestle, Bharat Elec, and Adani Enterpris. Financials: Quarterly Performance: On a consolidated basis, Asian Paints' revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 8,938.55 Crore, compared to Rs 8,358.91 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,080.73 Crore, up from Rs 677.78 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS stood at Rs 11.47 in June 2025, compared to Rs 7.22 in March 2025. Annual Performance: Asian Paints' annual revenue for March 2025 was Rs 33,905.62 Crore, compared to Rs 35,494.73 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year was Rs 3,569.00 Crore, down from Rs 5,424.69 Crore in the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 38.25 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 56.95 for the year-ending March 2024. title: Kopran Promoter Group to Increase Stake by 4.18% via Inter-Se Transfer
content: Kopran Ltd: Promoter group to increase stake by 4.18% via inter-se transfer, slated for completion by September 1, 2025. Shares will be transferred from Hridai Somani, Jaya Somani, Nupur Somani, Mridula Somani, Adarsh Somani, Suhrid Somani, Susheel G Somani, and Kumkum Somani to Varun Somani, Vadana Somani, and Surendra Somani. Also included are persons acting in concert, such as Oriental Enterprises Partnership Firm, Panaroma Finvest Private Ltd., Parijat Shipping and Finale Limited, and Sarvamangal Mercantile Company Ltd. The rationale cited for this transfer includes settling family disputes, maintaining peace, resolving differences, addressing inequalities within the family business, and safeguarding family property, aiming to avoid litigation and protect family honor. The promoter group is leveraging the exemption provided under Regulation 10(1)(a)(ii) of the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011, allowing the transfer without triggering an open offer. The acquirers affirmed adherence to disclosure norms outlined in Chapter V of the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeover) Regulations, 2011, and compliance with conditions specified under Regulation 10(1)(a) concerning exemptions. Details of the shareholding changes are as follows: Shareholding DetailsShareholder CategoryBefore Proposed TransactionAfter Proposed TransactionNo. of Shares / Voting rights% w.r.t total share capital of TCNo. of Shares / Voting rights% w.r.t total share capital of TCAcquirer(s) and PACs (other than sellers) (*)1,10,16,03522.811,30,32,02026.99Oriental Enterprises Partnership Firm17,64,7503.6517,64,7503.65Panorama Finvest Private. Ltd.38,00,0007.8738,00,0007.87Parijat Shipping and Finale Limited9,11,1091.899,11,1091.89Sarvamangal Mercantile Company Ltd.29,02,9516.0129,02,9516.01Surendra Somani4,10,0750.859,36,6102.00Vandana Somani6,92,6501.439,64,6502.00Varun Somani5,34,5001.1117,24,9503.57Seller (s)20,15,9854.18NilNilHridai Somani1,16,9000.24NilNilJaya Somani2,58,5000.54NilNilNurpur Somani2,70,0000.56NilNilMridula Somani7,88,4001.63NilNilAdarsh Somani1,81,2500.38NilNilSuhrid Somani93,3000.19NilNilSusheel G Somani2,72,0000.56NilNilKumkum Somani35,6350.07NilNil Transaction is expected to be completed by September 1, 2025.

title: Newly listed Ashish Kacholia-backed stock hits 20% UC to touch fresh high on winning over Rs 100-crore order from defence PSU - Check details
content: Shares of Shree Refrigerations Ltd, backed by investor Ashish Kacholia, hit the 20 percent upper circuit on the BSE on Monday after the company announced it had secured an order worth Rs 106.6 crore from Hindustan Shipyard Ltd. The stock opened with a gain of 4.22 percent and touched a fresh high of Rs 216.20 apiece. It has now advanced for two straight sessions. The company informed the exchange that the order is for the supply and installation of HVAC systems for five Fleet Support Ships to Hindustan Shipyard Limited, a government of India undertaking under the Ministry of Defence. Shree Refrigerations, which manufactures chillers, refrigeration and air-conditioning appliances, and marine chillers for the Indian Navy, operates out of Karad in Maharashtra. It also supplies specialised equipment such as cabin leakage testers and psychometric labs. Shree Refrigerations’ SME IPO clocks 174x subscription on final day: Check GMP, allotment and listing dates The company’s initial public offering, worth Rs 117 crore, was subscribed 174.24 times during July 25-29, receiving bids for 116.96 crore shares against the offer of 67.13 lakh shares through 3.08 lakh applications. The stock listed on the BSE SME platform on August 1 with a 35.9 percent premium, debuting at Rs 169.85 per share. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Shares of Shree Refrigerations Ltd, backed by investor Ashish Kacholia, hit the 20 percent upper circuit on the BSE on Monday after the company announced it had secured an order worth Rs 106.6 crore from Hindustan Shipyard Ltd.
summary_luhn: Shares of Shree Refrigerations Ltd, backed by investor Ashish Kacholia, hit the 20 percent upper circuit on the BSE on Monday after the company announced it had secured an order worth Rs 106.6 crore from Hindustan Shipyard Ltd.

title: Ola Electric Mobility shares surge 5% on buzz over Niti Aayog meet to push EV adoption
content: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility gained 5 percent on Monday, touching an intraday high of Rs 49.40 after reports that the government’s policy think-tank Niti Aayog has convened a meeting with leading two-wheeler makers to fast-track the electrification of motorcycles. Executives from Hero MotoCorp, Bajaj Auto, TVS Motor, Ola Electric, Ather Energy and Revolt are expected to join the deliberations, a Hindu Businessline report stated. The discussions will focus on measures to drive adoption of electric motorcycles, a segment that makes up two-thirds of India’s two-wheeler sales. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Government estimates suggest electric scooters could account for as much as 80 percent of sales by 2030, but motorcycles may still only reach 10 percent, dragging overall two-wheeler electrification to around 36 percent—well short of policy ambitions. Officials are expected to explore strategies such as scaling up production, reducing upfront costs, battery-swapping models and innovative financing options to make EV motorcycles more affordable and competitive, the report added. The meeting comes at a time when Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal has reiterated the company’s aim of cornering 25–30 percent share of the domestic two-wheeler EV market, backed by vertical integration and new launches. “Our mojo is still there,” Aggarwal said last week, adding that profitability would remain high as volumes scale. Investor sentiment has also been supported in recent sessions by expectations of a possible GST cut on entry-level two-wheelers, compact cars and hybrids. At about 1:15 pm, shares of the company were up at Rs 48.35, higher by 2.5 percent from the last close on the NSE. Ola Electric Mobility shares are up nearly 20 percent over the last week. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility gained 5 percent on Monday, touching an intraday high of Rs 49.40 after reports that the government’s policy think-tank Niti Aayog has convened a meeting with leading two-wheeler makers to fast-track the electrification of motorcycles.
summary_luhn: The meeting comes at a time when Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal has reiterated the company’s aim of cornering 25–30 percent share of the domestic two-wheeler EV market, backed by vertical integration and new launches.
summary_lsa: Executives from Hero MotoCorp, Bajaj Auto, TVS Motor, Ola Electric, Ather Energy and Revolt are expected to join the deliberations, a Hindu Businessline report stated.

title: Emami share price falls 5.23% in today's trading
content: Shares of Emami declined by 5.23% to Rs 579.95 in Monday's session, with the stock trading on the Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 904.09 Crore, compared to Rs 906.07 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 166.37 Crore, up from Rs 152.70 Crore in June 2024. The earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 3.76 for June 2025, from Rs 3.50 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 3,809.19 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 3,578.09 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 814.55 Crore, up from Rs 727.86 Crore in March 2024. The earnings per share (EPS) also saw an increase, reaching Rs 18.48 in March 2025, compared to Rs 16.55 in March 2024. Key financial figures from the consolidated income statement include:AnnualMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 3,809 CroreRs 3,578 CroreRs 3,405 CroreRs 3,192 CroreRs 2,880 CroreOther IncomeRs 68 CroreRs 46 CroreRs 68 CroreRs 95 CroreRs 70 CroreTotal IncomeRs 3,877 CroreRs 3,624 CroreRs 3,474 CroreRs 3,287 CroreRs 2,950 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 2,962 CroreRs 2,820 CroreRs 2,790 CroreRs 2,579 CroreRs 2,364 CroreEBITRs 915 CroreRs 804 CroreRs 684 CroreRs 707 CroreRs 586 CroreInterestRs 9 CroreRs 9 CroreRs 7 CroreRs 5 CroreRs 13 CroreTaxRs 91 CroreRs 66 CroreRs 42 CroreRs -148 CroreRs 114 CroreNet ProfitRs 814 CroreRs 727 CroreRs 634 CroreRs 851 CroreRs 458 CroreThe sales for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,809 Crore compared to Rs 3,578 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure stood at Rs 2,962 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 2,820 Crore in March 2024. Net profit increased from Rs 727 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 814 Crore in March 2025. The company’s board announced several dividends, including an interim dividend and a special dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) with an effective date of May 22, 2025. Earlier dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (400%) announced on December 27, 2024, with an effective date of February 4, 2025, and another interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (400%) announced on October 16, 2024, effective from November 18, 2024. Emami had previously announced bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on May 3, 2018, with an ex-bonus date of June 21, 2018, and a 1:2 bonus on May 6, 2013, with an ex-bonus date of June 26, 2013. Additionally, the company executed stock splits, including a split from a face value of Rs 2 to Rs 1 on July 21, 2010, and a split from Rs 10 to Rs 2 on February 16, 2004. Moneycontrol analysis on August 18, 2025, indicated a very bullish sentiment on the stock. Shares of Emami declined by 5.23% to Rs 579.95 in Monday's session, with the stock trading on the Nifty Midcap 150.
summary_lexrank: Emami had previously announced bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on May 3, 2018, with an ex-bonus date of June 21, 2018, and a 1:2 bonus on May 6, 2013, with an ex-bonus date of June 26, 2013.

title: Buy Infibeam Avenues; target of Rs 19: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Infibeam Avenues Infibeam Avenue’s reported gross revenue of INR 12,802 Mn., up 71.8% YoY (+10.3% QoQ), stood sharply above our estimates, outperforming the typical Q1 seasonal trend, driven by strong momentum in the payments business which grew by 74.0% YoY (+11.7% QoQ) to INR 12,265 Mn., while the E-com platform’s revenue grew by 33.4% YoY (-13.6% QoQ) to INR 537 Mn. TPV declined by 2.5% YoY (- 20.2% QoQ) to INR 1,927bn, while the payments NTR declined by 7.1% YoY (-1.9% QoQ) to 10.4bps. Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value Infibeam Avenues at 24.0x Jun’27 EPS, implying a target price of INR 19.0. We reiterate our “BUY” rating on the stock. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Infibeam Avenues - 25082025 - deven

title: Shreeji Shipping shares to make market debut tomorrow: GMP signals decent listing; what to expect?
content: The shares of Shreeji Shipping Global are set to make their market debut tomorrow (August 26). The Rs 411-crore IPO saw strong investor interest during its three days of public bidding, being subscribed over 58 times between August 19 and August 21. The maiden public issue of the Gujarat-based shipping and logistic solution company entirely comprised a fresh issue of shares at a price band of Rs 240-252 per share. Investors could bid for a minimum of 58 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 14,616 at the upper price band, and in multiples thereafter. Shreeji Shipping Global IPO GMP: Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium (GMP) of nearly 13.5 percent over the IPO price at Rs 286 apiece, according to data on Investorgain. This is higher than the 12 percent GMP cited by the site on the day of allotments. However, it is lower than the 15 percent cited on its last day of public bidding. According to IPO Watch, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with 11.11 percent GMP over the IPO price in the grey market. Shreeji Shipping Global IPO: What to expect? The strong subscription numbers for Shreeji Shipping Global IPO reflects overwhelming investor appetite, said Harshal Dasani, Business Head, INVasset PMS. "This enthusiasm came despite a moderation in topline performance, as revenue declined from Rs 736 crore in FY24 to Rs 610 crore in FY25. Profitability, however, showed resilience with a 13 percent year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 141 crore, aided by tighter cost controls and improved operational efficiency. The company's return ratios remain enviable, with return on equity near 44 percent and return on capital employed above 32 percent, although valuation multiples—around 29 times earnings and over five times book—sit well above sector norms," he added. Dasani noted that the dry-bulk segment remains highly exposed to global trade volatility and freight cycles, with concentration risk in customer exposure. "The fundamentals suggest a well-run company with strong profitability metrics, but the stretched valuations mean near-term listing gains could be offset by future earnings execution. For investors, the stock may be better suited as a tactical play on listing momentum, while long-term exposure requires careful monitoring of industry cycles," he further said. Narendra Solanki, Head of Fundamental Research, Investment Services, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers, advised investors to 'hold' the issue for the long term, according to their risk appetite. "At the upper price band company is valuing at P/E of 28.5x to its FY25 earnings, with EV/EBITDA of 21.4x and market cap of ₹ 41,055 million post issue of equity shares," he said. Follow all IPO news here. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: "At the upper price band company is valuing at P/E of 28.5x to its FY25 earnings, with EV/EBITDA of 21.4x and market cap of ₹ 41,055 million post issue of equity shares," he said.
summary_luhn: Shreeji Shipping Global IPO GMP: Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium (GMP) of nearly 13.5 percent over the IPO price at Rs 286 apiece, according to data on Investorgain.

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls marginally; stock touches day's high of Rs 1,940.10
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading lower in Monday's session. The stock is currently priced at Rs 1,928, a 0.27 percent decrease from its previous close, as of 12:30 pm. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,940.10 and a low of Rs 1,913.20. Financial Highlights Bharti Airtel has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual financial performance. Here’s a detailed look at the company’s financials: Quarterly Performance The company has shown robust growth in its quarterly results. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, marking a significant increase from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 7,339.00 Crore in June 2025 compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 10.26 in June 2025 from Rs 7.21 in June 2024.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26Annual Performance The annual financials reveal a strong upward trend. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021. The net profit also significantly improved, with Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025 compared to a loss of Rs -23,327.90 Crore in 2021. The earnings per share (EPS) saw a dramatic rise, reaching Rs 58.00 in 2025 from Rs -27.65 in 2021.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet ProfitRs -23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00The company’s book value per share (BVPS) has also consistently increased, from Rs 147.90 in 2021 to Rs 226.16 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) has improved significantly, reaching 25.58% in 2025 compared to -25.58% in 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased from 2.20 in 2021 to 1.13 in 2025. title: Accumulate PI Industries; target of Rs 4330: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on PI Industries Consolidated revenue for the quarter came in at INR 19,005 Mn. down 8.1% YoY (+6.3% QoQ), stood sharply below our estimates, due to subdued growth in the exports segment, partially offset by mid-single digit growth in the domestic segment. EBITDA stood at INR 5,191 Mn., down 11.0% YoY (+13.9% QoQ), stood sharply below our estimates, led by a sharp miss in revenue and higher-than-expected employee expense. Adjusted net profit declined by 10.9% YoY (+21.0% QoQ) to INR 4,000 Mn., sharply below our estimates, led by poor operational performance. Gross Profit margin expanded by 565bps YoY (+236bps QoQ) to 57.4%, led by a favorable shift in product mix towards higher-margin molecules, coupled with cost optimization efforts and stronger momentum in margin-accretive segments. EBITDA margin contracted by 88bps YoY (+182bps QoQ) to 27.3%, driven by higher development spend observed in pharma segment, incremental overheads from growth initiatives, and negative operating leverage, partially offset by improvement witnessed in gross margins. Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation to Jun’27 estimates. We value PI Industries at 32.0x Jun’27 EPS (near to its 10-year Avg. NTM P/E), implying a target price of INR 4,330. PI Industries is currently trading at 34.0x/29.3x of our FY26E/FY27E EPS estimates. We reiterate our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock as we see near-term pressures as transient, with H2FY26E recovery led by exports and new launches. A strong pipeline and growing pharma CRDMO underpin sustainable growth. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. PI Industries - 25082025 - deven

title: Duty-free cotton offers breather to textile stocks, but US tariff cloud continues to loom
content: Stocks such as Vardhman Textiles, Ambika Cotton Mills, Gokaldas Exports and Indo Count Industries enjoyed a short-lived buzz as India removed duties on raw cotton imports till September 30 in a signal to the US. While analysts believe that the temporary relief could bring respite to their tight margins over the near term as the government aims to cool domestic prices, the medium-term trajectory hinges on how these companies navigate the uncertainty arising from the tariffs levied by the US, and diversify into newer markets. From August 27, India will face 50 percent tariffs from the US administration. A planned visit by US trade negotiators to New Delhi from August 25-29 has been called off, delaying talks on a proposed bilateral trade agreement and dampening hopes of relief from an additional 25 percent US levy starting August 27. Sentiment positive but gaps remain Independent analyst Ambareesh Baliga agreed that the move is sentimentally positive for cotton stocks that have been wealth destroyers this year. Lower input costs will make the supply chain more competitive, benefiting the entire textile value chain, including yarn, fabric, garments and made-ups, he said. However, Baliga warned that for US-bound exports of apparel and home textiles, the gap would remain significant compared to competing countries such as Bangladesh and Vietnam unless tariffs are reduced to 25 percent. Market expert Ajay Bagga agreed, saying that while the 11 percent duty waiver on raw cotton is a helpful short-term relief for the textile industry, it’s not enough on its own. He believes that the government should roll out a broader support package that includes easier loan access, export incentives and measures to reduce raw material costs. Such steps would give the entire textile value chain, from yarn to garments, the strength to handle challenges like high US tariffs and intense global competition. Indian exports previously faced duties of 0-5 percent, with some textiles taxed at between 9 and 13 percent before tariffs were raised under the Trump administration. Now, the 50 percent tariff is not a standalone levy, it is in addition to the standard US import duty. Reports suggested total duties on Indian textiles and apparel exports to the US will now hit alarming levels across various categories: carpets at 52.9 percent, knitted garments at 63.9 percent, woven garments at 60.3 percent, and textiles and made-ups at 59 percent. This underscores how uncompetitive Indian products will become under the new regime, effectively pricing them out of the US market. Competing nations have the edge Moreover, it makes Indian garment exporters uncompetitive against rivals in Bangladesh and Vietnam, where US duties are around 20 percent, and China, at 30 percent. Most of these companies are heavily dependent on the US. Gokaldas Exports derives around 70 percent of its revenue from the North American country. Welspun Living earns about 65 percent of its revenue from the US, where it is a leading exporter of towels and bed linen. Indo Count Industries also derives nearly 70 percent of its sales from exports, with the US as its dominant market. Unless these players diversify beyond the US, maintaining profitability in the coming quarters will be challenging, experts warned. Diversification and margin play On its earnings call, Gokaldas Exports said the second half of the fiscal looks even more challenging as US brands have begun raising end-retail prices, which could hit demand and drive tougher negotiations on pricing. The company, however, plans to diversify its business geographically to reduce dependence on a single market. Notably, exports to the EU rose to 13.4 percent in Q1FY26 from 11.6 percent in Q4FY25. Vardhman Textiles, on the other hand, expects margins to improve as duty-free cotton imports kick in. The company has avoided absorbing any US tariff impact in its yarn business so far, and since 30-35 percent of its exports go to Bangladesh, no significant business disruption has been seen. So far this year, shares of Vardhman Textiles, Ambika Cotton Mills, Gokaldas Exports and Indo Count Industries have dropped up to 30 percent. According to Baliga, much of the tariff impact is already priced in, but the sector’s fortunes now hinge on whether the US administration rolls back the duties imposed on India, something that could ease margin stress for these textile players. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: From August 27, India will face 50 percent tariffs from the US administration.
summary_luhn: Stocks such as Vardhman Textiles, Ambika Cotton Mills, Gokaldas Exports and Indo Count Industries enjoyed a short-lived buzz as India removed duties on raw cotton imports till September 30 in a signal to the US.
summary_lsa: So far this year, shares of Vardhman Textiles, Ambika Cotton Mills, Gokaldas Exports and Indo Count Industries have dropped up to 30 percent.
summary_textrank: While analysts believe that the temporary relief could bring respite to their tight margins over the near term as the government aims to cool domestic prices, the medium-term trajectory hinges on how these companies navigate the uncertainty arising from the tariffs levied by the US, and diversify into newer markets.

title: ICRA Reaffirms Bikaji Foods' Bank Facilities Rating
content: ICRA Reaffirms Rating for Bikaji Foods' Bank Facilities ICRA Limited has reaffirmed its rating for Bikaji Foods International Limited's bank facilities, according to a company filing dated August 25, 2025. The rating applies to bank facilities totaling ₹147.32 Crore. title: KPIT among top engineering R&D plays as Motilal initiates coverage: Check out the rationale
content: Despite a recent slowdown in capex by western car makers, the long-term outlook remains robust, Motilal Oswal said in a note, as global mobility is accelerating the role of software in vehicles prompting it to initiate coverage on automotive engineering R&D (ER&D) players KPIT Tech, Tata Technologies and Tata Elxsi. The note said ER&D specialists with 'domain depth, co-development, and global delivery' are well-poised to benefit from the tailwinds. "Despite the recent moderation in capex cycles among Western OEMs, the long-term outlook remains robust. Asian OEMs are pivoting toward hybrids and localized strategies, while global players are recognizing software as the key competitive frontier," the note said. Motilal Oswal added that several Asian OEMs are 'pivoting' toward hybrids and more localised strategies, and global players are betting on software as the next 'competitive frontier'. All this, MOSL said, makes specialized engineering service players an attract longer term bets. MOSL note said the shift is mobility has been towards CASE (connected, autonomous, shared, electric), which is accelerating the role of software in vehicles. As a result, OEMs are moving towards a centralized domain and preparing for software-defined vehicles (SDVs). Also, regulations world over are nudging automakers towards greener mobility, leading to electric powertrains. For MOSL, KPIT Technologies is a Buy with a target of Rs 1,600 per share, valued at 40x FY27E EPS, reflecting its strength in SDV and 'middleware' capabilities. "The company’s core strengths lie in embedded software development, E/E (Electrical/Electronic) architecture, and middleware consulting, accounting for over 80% of its revenue," Motilal Oswal said. The note also initiated coverage on Tata Tech and Tata Elexi, though with a Sell rating. For Tata Elxsi, there is a near-term growth headwind in Europe, along with a less favourable risk–reward at current valuation, said MOSL. Tata Tech is at a discount to KPIT owing to its lower margin profile due to 'higher mechanical exposure, client concentration risks, and modest growth visibility.' Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Accumulate Devyani International; target of Rs 193: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Devyani International Devyani International’s Q1FY26 performance stood below our estimates across the metrics, led by subdued SSSG growth in domestic market and lower traction in international markets, compounded by weaker operational performance. Devyani’s consolidated revenue grew by 11.1% YoY (+11.9% QoQ) to INR 13,570 Mn., led by strong growth in KFC (+10.5% YoY), Costa (+14.1% YoY), and the food court business in India, aided by 11.2% YoY growth in international operations. The company added a 103 net stores in India and 3 stores in international markets, taking the total store count (Inc. Sky Gate) to 2,145. Moreover, during Q1FY26, it acquired an 86.13% stake in Sky Gate Hospitality (with total 105 outlets), enhancing its footprint in Biryani and Indian cuisine. Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value Devyani at 22.5x Jun’27 EBITDA, implying a target price of INR 193. We reiterate our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. title: Sundaram Fin shares fall 3.6% among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Sundaram Fin were trading down by 3.6% at Rs 5,079 in Monday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 12:00 pm. Financial Performance Sundaram Fin's financial performance shows a steady increase in both revenue and net profit over the past year. The consolidated quarterly revenue has risen consistently, with the latest figure for June 2025 standing at Rs 2,348.93 Crore. This represents an 20.36% increase compared to the revenue of Rs 1,951.60 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit for June 2025 was Rs 411.80 Crore, slightly up from Rs 402.19 Crore in June 2024. The consolidated yearly revenue has also shown substantial growth, increasing from Rs 5,247.67 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,485.63 Crore in 2025. The net profit has followed a similar upward trajectory, rising from Rs 1,002.05 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,812.81 Crore in 2025. title: JK Paper, TNPL, other paper stocks rise up to 17% as Centre sets minimum price on import of packaging material
content: Shares of paper companies surged up to 17 percent in early trade on August 25 after the government imposed a Minimum Import Price (MIP) on Virgin Multi-layer Paper Board (VMPB), a move aimed at curbing cheaper imports. Tamilnadu Newsprint and Papers Ltd (TNPL) led the rally, building on early gains to climb by 17 percent to an intraday high of Rs 179.90 on the NSE after two consecutive sessions of decline. JK Paper also advanced sharply, rising 15 percent after four days of losses. West Coast Paper Mills jumped 13.71 percent, while Orient Paper and Industries rose 8.16 percent. Malu Paper Mills and Andhra Paper also gained up to 12 percent in early trade. The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT), in a notification, had said that the MIP will remain in force till March 31, 2026. By fixing a floor price for imports, Centre has effectively made cheap foreign supplies costlier, providing relief to domestic producers. Paper companies in India have long complained of competition from low-priced imports, particularly from Indonesia and China. The Indian Paper Manufacturers Association had in June sought an anti-dumping probe against imports of VMPB from Indonesia. Virgin Multi-layer Paper Board is widely used in packaging for pharmaceuticals, FMCG, food and beverages, electronics, cosmetics, liquor, and also in publishing. By fixing a minimum import price, the government has made cheap imports costlier. This protects local companies, as importers either have to pay more for imported paper board or buy from Indian producers. As a result, domestic demand is expected to shift towards Indian paper companies. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Nazara Tech shares fall 11% to hit 3-month low, Delta Corp down 2% as online gaming bill becomes law
content: The shares of gaming companies extended significant losses on August 25 after President Droupadi Murmu gave her assent to the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, officially making it a law in India. Nazara Technologies shares tumbled over 11 percent to trade at Rs 1,026.70 apiece in the morning. Notably, this is the lowest level seen by the stock in over three months. The gaming stock has so far fallen over 26 percent in the past five days, and currently has a P/E ratio of nearly 95. Delta Corp shares meanwhile dropped around 2 percent to trade at Rs 86.29 apiece. The stock has dropped nearly 6 percent in the past six months, and is down around 23 percent in 2025 so far. The new law prohibits online money games where a user makes a deposit, directly or indirectly, with the expectation of earning winnings on that deposit. Analysts expect that the immediate fallout of the new law would be job losses, the collapse of start-ups, and a sharp drop in foreign and domestic investment. The move threatens to wipe out around 2 lakh jobs, Rs 25,000 crore in foreign direct investment, and Rs 20,000 crore in tax revenues, they say. The move is set to give a blow to the country's $3.8 billion gaming industry that has drawn the attention of global investors and fostered fantasy sports apps like Dream11, Games24X7 and Mobile Premier League. The law includes an imprisonment of up to three years and/or a fine of up to Rs 1 crore. It also includes a provision where repeated offences could attract 3-5 years imprisonment and fines up to Rs 2 crore. The proposed legislation also recommends a regulator for e-sports, educational platforms, and social games. Minister for Electronics and Information Technology Ashwini Vaishnaw while tabling the bill in Rajya Sabha termed online money games as a 'public health risk". "There are addiction and withdrawal symptoms. Many families have been destroyed," Vaishnaw said. The minister also said that around 45 crore people have been affected, and around Rs 20,000 crore have been lost because of online money games. Nazara Tech said on August 22 its associate firm, Moonshine Technologies, which operates PokerBaazi and other card-based platforms, has ceased offering online games played with money. Ananay Jain, Partner, Grant Thornton Bharat said that the blanket restrictions on certain real-money games may stifle segments of the gaming market that were previously generating significant revenue, particularly in mobile gaming and tournament-based platforms. "Smaller start-ups and emerging developers may face compliance burdens and financial strain due to penalties and regulatory requirements." Several real-money gaming (RMG) companies are likely to file writ petitions, as early as possible this week, in 2-3 high courts of the country against the contentious online-gaming Act passed by the Parliament on Thursday, three people directly aware of the matter told Moneycontrol. Sources say, the companies are having consultations currently to decide whether to file petitions individually or through federations, in order to seek a stay on the implementation of the 'Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025'. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Accumulate Vinati Organics; target of Rs 1880: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Vinati Organics Q1FY26 Revenue grew marginally by 3.3% YoY (-16.4% QoQ) to INR 5,420 Mn., stood below our estimates by 4.6%. Gross profit grew by heathy rate of 20.4% YoY (- 7.7% QoQ) to INR 2837 Mn., resulting in improvement of gross margin by 744bps YoY (+496bps QoQ) to 52.3%. EBITDA grew at a robust pace of 28.1% YoY (-11.5% QoQ) to INR 1,597 Mn., stood above our estimates by 6.7%, driven by significant improvement in gross margins. While management has guided EBITDA margins to remain in the range of 26.0 to 27.0%, margins for Q1FY26 came in significantly higher at 29.5% (+571bps YoY / +164bps QoQ). Net profit stood at INR 1,042 Mn, up 23.8% YoY (-15.3% QoQ), above our estimates by 4.8%, driven by improved operational performance. Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value Vinati Organics at 34.0x Jun’27 EPS, implying a target price of INR 1,880. We reiterate our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock. title: Infosys among top gainers on Nifty 50; share price gains 3.14%
content: In Monday's session, Infosys was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, with its share price rising by 3.14% to Rs 1,534.20. Other top gainers on Nifty 50 included TCS, Wipro, HCL Tech, and Tech Mahindra. Financial Highlights Infosys's financial performance shows consistent growth over the years. Here's a summary of their consolidated financials: Consolidated Income Statement (Quarterly)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70The quarterly revenue has increased from Rs 39,315.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 42,279.00 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also saw an increase from Rs 6,374.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 6,924.00 Crore in June 2025. Consolidated Income Statement (Annual)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual revenue has consistently increased from Rs 100,472.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 162,990.00 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 19,423.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 26,750.00 Crore in 2025. Consolidated Yearly Income StatementMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 162,990 CroreRs 153,670 CroreRs 146,767 CroreRs 121,641 CroreRs 100,472 CroreOther IncomeRs 3,600 CroreRs 4,711 CroreRs 2,701 CroreRs 2,295 CroreRs 2,201 CroreTotal IncomeRs 166,590 CroreRs 158,381 CroreRs 149,468 CroreRs 123,936 CroreRs 102,673 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 128,566 CroreRs 121,923 CroreRs 115,862 CroreRs 93,626 CroreRs 75,850 CroreEBITRs 38,024 CroreRs 36,458 CroreRs 33,606 CroreRs 30,310 CroreRs 26,823 CroreInterestRs 416 CroreRs 470 CroreRs 284 CroreRs 200 CroreRs 195 CroreTaxRs 10,858 CroreRs 9,740 CroreRs 9,214 CroreRs 7,964 CroreRs 7,205 CroreNet ProfitRs 26,750 CroreRs 26,248 CroreRs 24,108 CroreRs 22,146 CroreRs 19,423 CroreCorporate Actions Infosys has announced several corporate actions, including bonus issues and dividends. Key highlights include:Bonus shares were issued with a ratio of 1:1 on multiple occasions, including July 13, 2018, June 15, 2015, December 2, 2014, and July 13, 2006.A bonus issue with a ratio of 3:1 occurred on July 1, 2004.The stock underwent a split on January 24, 2000, with the face value changing from Rs 10 to Rs 5.The company has also announced several dividends, with the latest final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share (440%) announced on April 17, 2025, and an effective date of May 30, 2025. In Monday's session, Infosys was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: PTC Industries Appoints Baljinder Singh Koura as VP, Aerospace Castings
content: PTC Industries (PTCIL) Appoints Baljinder Singh Koura VP of Aerospace Castings at Aerolloy Technologies. PTC Industries Limited (PTCIL) announced the appointment of Baljinder Singh (Bal) Koura as Vice President – Operations, Aerospace Castings at Aerolloy Technologies Limited (ATL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of PTC. Koura brings over three decades of leadership experience in operations, manufacturing, supply chain management, and turnaround programs across the aerospace, automotive, and industrial sectors. He previously held senior leadership roles at Rolls-Royce, GE Aviation, and Unipol Group, driving new facility setups and operational excellence across the UK, India, Europe, and Mexico. At Aerolloy Technologies Limited, Koura will spearhead operational excellence, bolster plant performance, and support the company's scaling journey in aerospace castings to meet global OEM demands, the company said in a statement. Baljinder Singh Koura stated, "I am honored to join PTC and Aerolloy Technologies. PTC's vision of building India's capabilities in aerospace and defense manufacturing resonates deeply with me. I look forward to strengthening operations, driving excellence, and contributing to the company's mission." Koura holds an MBA from De Montfort University and advanced qualifications in Quality and Environmental Management. He has also championed people development, ESG, and CSR initiatives. PTC Industries Limited is an Indian manufacturer of precision metal components for critical applications for over 60 years. Through Aerolloy Technologies Limited, the company manufactures and supplies Titanium and Superalloy castings for Aerospace and Defence applications within India and for export markets. The company is expanding its capability with a multi-million-dollar investment in a new manufacturing facility at its 50 acres land in the Lucknow node of the Uttar Pradesh Defence Industrial Corridor. This facility will house a vertically integrated plant with a Titanium and Superalloy Mill, producing aerospace grade ingots, billets, bars, plates, and sheets in critical and strategic materials.
summary_lexrank: At Aerolloy Technologies Limited, Koura will spearhead operational excellence, bolster plant performance, and support the company's scaling journey in aerospace castings to meet global OEM demands, the company said in a statement.
summary_luhn: Through Aerolloy Technologies Limited, the company manufactures and supplies Titanium and Superalloy castings for Aerospace and Defence applications within India and for export markets.
summary_lsa: PTC's vision of building India's capabilities in aerospace and defense manufacturing resonates deeply with me.
summary_textrank: Through Aerolloy Technologies Limited, the company manufactures and supplies Titanium and Superalloy castings for Aerospace and Defence applications within India and for export markets.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat; stock hits day's high of Rs 3,617.90
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading flat in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,599.70 as of 10.40 am, a 0.11 percent increase from its previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,617.90 and a day's low of Rs 3,586.60. Financial Performance: Larsen & Toubro has demonstrated strong financial performance, as seen in both its quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, up from Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, compared to Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to Rs 26.30 in June 2025 from Rs 20.26 in June 2024. Annually, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also saw a rise, from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in March 2025. title: FSN E-Commerce Ventures Nykaa shares hit 52-week high
content: Shares of FSN E-Commerce Ventures Nykaa reached a 52-week high of Rs 230.80 on the BSE in Monday's session. At 10:36 am, the stock was trading at Rs 229, reflecting a gain of 1.80% from its previous close. Financial Snapshot FSN E-Commerce Ventures Nykaa's financial performance indicates consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the recent years. The following tables provide an overview of the company's consolidated financial results. Revenue The company has demonstrated strong revenue growth, with annual revenue increasing from Rs 2,440.90 Crore in 2021 to Rs 7,949.82 Crore in 2025. The quarterly revenue also shows an upward trend, reaching Rs 2,154.94 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025.YearRevenue (Rs Crore)20212,440.9020223,773.9420235,143.8020246,385.6320257,949.82Net Profit The net profit has also seen a significant increase, with the annual net profit rising from Rs 61.95 Crore in 2021 to Rs 73.70 Crore in 2025. On August 12, 2025, a conference call was held regarding the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The video recording link is available on the company's website. Furthermore, the company secretary and compliance officer resigned on August 12, 2025. The company had previously issued bonus shares with an ex-bonus date of November 10, 2022, in the ratio of 5:1, offering 5 new shares for every 1 existing share. The announcement date for this bonus issue was October 3, 2022, with a record date of November 11, 2022. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bullish sentiment on the stock as of August 25, 2025. With the stock trading at Rs 229, FSN E-Commerce Ventures Nykaa has shown positive momentum, reaching a new 52-week high and reflecting strong financial performance and bullish market sentiment.

title: Vodafone Idea shares rise 2.12% in morning trade; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 7.22 in Monday's session, emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. As of around 10:40 am, the stock reflected positive momentum in early trading hours. This increase is relative to the previous day's closing price. Financial Snapshot: A review of Vodafone Idea's financials reveals the following trends: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating pattern. The revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 11,022.50 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 10,508.30 Crore in June 2024. However, the net profit remained negative, with a loss of Rs -6,608.10 Crore in June 2025 compared to a loss of Rs -6,432.20 Crore in June 2024. The EPS also reflected a loss, with Rs -0.63 in June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreRs 11,022.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 Crore-Rs 6,608.10 CroreEPS-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01-0.63Consolidated Yearly Performance: Examining the consolidated yearly data, the revenue for March 2025 was Rs 43,571.30 Crore, which is an increase compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in March 2024. The net profit, however, remained negative, with a loss of Rs -27,385.20 Crore in March 2025. The EPS also showed a loss of Rs -4.01.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-15.40-9.83-8.43-6.41-4.01BVPS-13.30-19.29-15.28-20.78-9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-4.12-3.08-0.18-1.99-2.79Vodafone Idea's annual income statement shows consistent sales. The sales increased by 2.15% from Rs 42,651 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 43,571 Crore in March 2025.Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 43,571 CroreRs 42,651 CroreRs 42,177 CroreRs 38,515 CroreRs 41,952 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,020 CroreRs 113 CroreRs 311 CroreRs 129 CroreRs 174 CroreTotal IncomeRs 44,591 CroreRs 42,764 CroreRs 42,488 CroreRs 38,644 CroreRs 42,126 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 47,417 CroreRs 47,403 CroreRs 48,432 CroreRs 45,899 CroreRs 68,613 CroreEBIT-Rs 2,825 Crore-Rs 4,638 Crore-Rs 5,943 Crore-Rs 7,254 Crore-Rs 26,486 CroreInterestRs 24,543 CroreRs 25,765 CroreRs 23,354 CroreRs 20,980 CroreRs 17,998 CroreTaxRs 15 CroreRs 828 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 11 Crore-Rs 20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 27,385 Crore-Rs 31,232 Crore-Rs 29,301 Crore-Rs 28,246 Crore-Rs 44,464 CroreThe cash flow statement shows cash flow from operating activities at Rs 9,290 Crore for March 2025. The balance sheet shows that the total liabilities are Rs 197,866 Crore and total assets are Rs 197,866 Crore as of March 2025. Key financial ratios show a basic EPS of Rs -4.01 and diluted EPS of Rs -4.01 as of March 2025. The company’s debt to equity ratio is -2.79. Corporate Actions: Vodafone Idea had an earning call on August 18, 2025, regarding the company's performance for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Additionally, the company entered a Power Purchase Agreement and a Share Purchase Agreement on August 12, 2025, to acquire at least 26% equity share capital of Aditya Birla Renewables SPV 3 Limited. Furthermore, the company announced a rights issue with existing ratio of 38 and offered ratio of 87, face value of Rs 10 and premium of Rs 3. The exrights date was March 29, 2019 and rights ratio was 87:38. Moneycontrol analysis, conducted on August 20, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment on the stock. The stock movement occurred around 10:40 am, reflecting positive momentum in early trading hours.

title: Top midcap losers: Sundaram Fin shares fall 3.3%; Hitachi Energy, Star Health also drag on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In Monday's session, Sundaram Fin's stock was among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150, trading at Rs 5,094.10. This represents a 3.31% decrease from its previous close, as of 10:30 am. Other stocks that saw a decline include Hitachi Energy, trading at Rs 19,415.00 with a fall of 2.31%, and Star Health, trading at Rs 437.75, down by 1.53%. L&T Finance was trading at Rs 219.83, a decrease of 1.29%, while BSE Limited was at Rs 2,303.00, a fall of 1.28%. Corporate Actions: Sundaram Fin Sundaram Finance Ltd. announced its results press release for the period ending June 30, 2025, on August 5, 2025. Additionally, the company informed BSE about standalone & consolidated financial results, and limited review report for June 30, 2025, also on August 5, 2025. A minor correction in the Notice to the 72nd Annual General Meeting was announced on July 21, 2025. The company has announced a final dividend of Rs. 21.00 per share (210%) with an effective date of July 9, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs. 14.00 per share (140%) was announced on February 3, 2025, with an effective date of February 7, 2025. Sundaram Fin had a bonus issue on December 13, 2012, with a bonus ratio of 1:1. Further bonus issues were announced on August 22, 2008 (1:1), November 1, 1995 (1:1), and two others on June 17, 1991, and June 17, 1986, both with a 1:1 ratio. The company had a rights issue with a rights ratio of 1:1, announced on September 15, 1995. title: Jindal Stainless shares surge 4.18% amid heavy volume trading; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Jindal Stainless rose sharply in Monday's trading session, gaining 4.18% to trade at Rs 810.05. The stock experienced high volume and a surge in trading activity, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index as of 10:26 am. title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat in today's session; over 1.2 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading flat in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,596.30. The stock showed a marginal increase of 0.01% from its previous close, with over 1.2 lakh shares traded on the NSE. Trading Volume & Market Impact In today's session, the traded volume for Larsen & Toubro shares reached 121,135 on the NSE. Recent Financial Performance The consolidated revenue for Larsen & Toubro has shown consistent growth over the past few years. The annual revenue increased from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,734.45 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in 2025. The company's earnings per share (EPS) rose from Rs 82.49 in 2021 to Rs 109.36 in 2025. The quarterly revenue also demonstrates a positive trend. For the quarter-ending June 2025, the company reported a revenue of Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, while the EPS stood at Rs 26.30. title: Hindustan Zinc shares rise 2% in morning trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Zinc gained 2% to trade at Rs 433.40 in Monday's session. At 10:26 am, the stock saw positive movement compared to its previous close, reflecting a favorable shift in investor activity. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Corporate Actions: Hindustan Zinc announced several corporate actions, including newspaper publications regarding the transfer of equity shares to IEPF on August 23, 2025, and analyst/investor meet intimations on August 18, 2025. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 10 per share (500%) on June 6, 2025, with an effective date of June 17, 2025. Other interim dividends were announced on August 14, 2024 (Rs 19 per share) and May 2, 2024 (Rs 10 per share). A bonus issue was announced on January 19, 2011, with a 1:1 ratio and a record date of March 8, 2011. A stock split was also announced on the same day, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2, effective from March 7, 2011. Moneycontrol analysis indicated a bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 18, 2025.

The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 0.89%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading lower in Monday's session. The stock, currently priced at Rs 1,916.10, experienced a decline of 0.89% and was listed among the top losers on Nifty 50 at 10:10 am. This decline reflects a shift in investor sentiment towards the stock. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Bharti Airtel:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 increased to Rs 49,462.60 crore compared to Rs 38,506.40 crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 7,339.00 crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 crore in June 2024. The EPS increased to 10.26 for the quarter-ending June 2025, compared to 7.21 in June 2024. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance of Bharti Airtel:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet ProfitRs -23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13The annual revenue has increased from Rs 100,615.80 crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 crore in 2025. title: Aditya Birla Fashion shares rise 2.13% in today's trading session
content: Shares of Aditya Birla Fashion were trading at Rs 82.98, a 2.13% increase in Monday's session. The stock demonstrated positive movement, driven by investor activity. Looking at the company's financial performance, Aditya Birla Fashion 's consolidated quarterly revenue shows fluctuations. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 3,427.82 Crore, which increased to Rs 3,643.86 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It further rose to Rs 4,304.69 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, before declining to Rs 1,719.48 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The most recent quarter, ending June 2025, shows a revenue of Rs 1,831.46 Crore. The company's consolidated quarterly net profit has been negative across the observed period. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs -214.92 Crore, nearly the same for the quarter-ending September 2024 at Rs -214.70 Crore. The losses decreased to Rs -33.42 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024 and further to Rs -23.55 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. However, the losses increased again to Rs -227.98 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. The consolidated quarterly EPS shows a similar trend, with a loss of Rs -1.60 for the quarter-ending June 2024, Rs -1.81 for the quarter-ending September 2024, Rs -0.48 for the quarter-ending December 2024, Rs -0.15 for the quarter-ending March 2025, and Rs -1.74 for the quarter-ending June 2025. Analyzing Aditya Birla Fashion's consolidated annual revenue, there is a fluctuating trend. In 2021, the revenue was Rs 5,248.92 Crore, which increased to Rs 8,136.22 Crore in 2022. The revenue further rose to Rs 12,417.90 Crore in 2023 and Rs 13,995.86 Crore in 2024. However, there was a significant decline in 2025, with the revenue at Rs 7,354.73 Crore. The consolidated annual net profit for Aditya Birla Fashion has been negative over the observed period. The net profit was Rs -735.66 Crore in 2021, improving to Rs -120.70 Crore in 2022, and further to Rs -66.31 Crore in 2023. However, losses increased again to Rs -748.66 Crore in 2024 and Rs -437.94 Crore in 2025. The consolidated annual EPS shows a similar trend, with a loss of Rs -8.23 in 2021, improving to Rs -1.18 in 2022 and Rs -0.38 in 2023. However, the losses worsened again to Rs -6.52 in 2024 and Rs -3.53 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) has been increasing annually, from Rs 29.25 in 2021 to Rs 29.72 in 2022, Rs 35.27 in 2023, Rs 46.51 in 2024, and Rs 55.83 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) has been negative throughout the period, with values of -25.43% in 2021, -3.92% in 2022, -1.07% in 2023, -15.56% in 2024, and -5.51% in 2025. title: Bajaj Holdings shares fall 2.30% in morning trade, among top losers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Bajaj Holdings declined 2.30% to Rs 13,233.00 in Monday's session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index. The decline occurred around 10:09 am. Financial Highlights: Bajaj Holdings' financial performance shows notable trends over the past few years. Here's a summary of the key financial data: Consolidated Revenue:The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 684.42 Crore, compared to Rs 1,648.69 Crore in March 2024.The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 324.66 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 145.26 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025.Net Profit:The consolidated net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 494.17 Crore, a decrease from Rs 1,409.61 Crore in March 2024.For the quarter ending June 2025, the net profit reached Rs 1,610.52 Crore, substantially higher than the Rs 142.84 Crore reported for the quarter ending March 2025.Earnings Per Share (EPS):The EPS for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 585.90, down from Rs 653.00 in March 2024.The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 313.30, compared to Rs 155.00 for the quarter ending March 2025.Key Financial Ratios: The financial ratios of Bajaj Holdings provide insights into its efficiency, profitability, and solvency. title: Infosys shares among top gainers on Nifty 50; stock jumps 2.70%
content: At 10:10 am on Monday, Infosys shares were trading at Rs 1,527.60, a gain of 2.70% and among the top gainers on Nifty 50. The stock is showing positive movement in today's session. On the financial front, Infosys has demonstrated steady financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, compared to Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 6,924 Crore, up from Rs 6,374 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased from Rs 15.38 in June 2024 to Rs 16.70 in June 2025. Here is a summary of Infosys's key quarterly financial data:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70The yearly consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. Revenue increased from Rs 153,670 Crore in 2024 to Rs 162,990 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose from Rs 26,248 Crore in 2024 to Rs 26,750 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 63.39 in 2024 to Rs 64.50 in 2025. Here is a summary of Infosys's key yearly financial data:Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company has also announced several corporate actions. On April 17, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 22 per share was announced, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Previously, an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share was announced on October 17, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 20 along with a special dividend of Rs 8 was announced on April 18, 2024. Infosys had a neutral sentiment according to a Moneycontrol analysis on August 20, 2025. The sales for the year ending March 2025 were Rs 162,990 Crore compared to Rs 153,670 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 26,750 Crore, up from Rs 26,248 Crore in the previous year. Basic EPS (Rs.) for March 2025 was 64.50, compared to 63.39 for March 2024. Book Value [Excl. Reval Reserve]/Share (Rs.) for March 2025 was 231.11, up from 212.74 for March 2024. Dividend/Share (Rs.) for March 2025 was 43.00, compared to 46.00 for March 2024. Return on Networth / Equity (%) for March 2025 was 27.87, compared to 29.77 for March 2024. Debt to Equity (x) for March 2025 was 0.00, the same as in March 2024. P/E (x) for March 2025 was 24.35, compared to 23.63 for March 2024. P/B (x) for March 2025 was 6.80, compared to 7.05 for March 2024. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,527.60, Infosys is demonstrating a positive trend, reflected in both its stock performance and recent financial results.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise 2.34%; among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's trading session. At 10:10 am, the stock price of TCS was Rs 3,125.50, a 2.34% increase. Tata Consultancy Services has announced multiple press releases recently. On August 20, 2025, the company declared that Finnish Retailer Kesko Partners would work with TCS to drive AI-Powered Retail Transformation. On August 19, 2025, TCS launched a new AI-Enhanced Operations Center In Latin America. Here is a look at the company's financial performance over the last few years:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs.)BVPS (Rs.)ROE (%)Debt to Equity2021164,177.0032,562.0086.71235.4337.520.002022191,754.0038,449.00103.62245.4842.990.002023225,458.0042,303.00115.19249.2046.610.002024240,893.0046,099.00125.88252.2650.730.002025255,324.0048,797.00134.19261.7651.240.00The annual data shows a consistent increase in revenue and net profit for Tata Consultancy Services. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,324.00 Crore, which is increased by 5.99 percent compared to the previous year. Net profit increased from Rs 46,099.00 Crore in 2024 to Rs 48,797.00 Crore in 2025. The company’s Return on Equity (ROE) has also seen a steady rise, reaching 51.24% in March 2025. Here is a summary of the key financials on a quarterly basis:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs.)Jun 202462,613.0012,105.0033.28Sep 202464,259.0011,955.0032.92Dec 202463,973.0012,444.0034.21Mar 202564,479.0012,293.0033.79Jun 202563,437.0012,819.0035.27Quarterly results show that revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437.00 Crore, compared to Rs 62,613.00 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 12,819.00 Crore, compared to Rs 12,105.00 Crore in June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 33.28 in June 2024 to Rs 35.27 in June 2025. Tata Consultancy Services has announced several dividends. Key dividend announcements include:Rs 11.00 per share interim dividend, announced on June 27, 2025, effective July 16, 2025.Rs 30.00 per share final dividend, announced on April 11, 2025, effective June 4, 2025.Rs 66.00 per share special dividend, announced on January 9, 2025, effective January 17, 2025.The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the last bonus issue on April 19, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. Based on a Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for the stock was bearish as of August 20, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,125.50, Tata Consultancy Services has shown strong performance and is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index in today's session.

title: LTIMindtree shares rise 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of LTIMindtree gained 2.07% to trade at Rs 5,332.50 in morning trade. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. Financial Highlights LTIMindtree's financial performance shows consistent growth over the recent quarters and years. Here's a summary of the company's consolidated financial data: Quarterly Performance: The company has demonstrated steady revenue and net profit growth over the last five quarters. The revenue increased from Rs 9,142.60 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 9,840.60 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also rose from Rs 1,135.10 Crore to Rs 1,254.60 Crore during the same period.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 9,142.60 CroreRs 9,432.90 CroreRs 9,660.90 CroreRs 9,771.70 CroreRs 9,840.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,135.10 CroreRs 1,251.60 CroreRs 1,086.70 CroreRs 1,128.60 CroreRs 1,254.60 CroreEPS38.3042.2536.6538.1042.33Annual Performance: The yearly data indicates a strong upward trend in revenue, net profit, and EPS. Revenue increased steadily from Rs 12,369.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 38,008.10 Crore in 2025. Similarly, net profit rose from Rs 1,938.20 Crore to Rs 4,602.00 Crore, and EPS increased from Rs 110.98 to Rs 155.29.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,369.80 CroreRs 15,668.70 CroreRs 33,183.00 CroreRs 35,517.00 CroreRs 38,008.10 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,938.20 CroreRs 2,298.50 CroreRs 4,410.30 CroreRs 4,584.60 CroreRs 4,602.00 CroreEPS110.98131.19149.07154.85155.29BVPS417.55504.02560.78676.56766.83ROE26.5026.0526.5622.8920.26Debt to Equity0.010.090.010.000.00The income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 38,008 Crore, other income of Rs 989 Crore, and total expenditure of Rs 32,504 Crore. The EBIT stood at Rs 6,493 Crore, with interest at Rs 278 Crore and tax at Rs 1,612 Crore, resulting in a net profit of Rs 4,602 Crore. Corporate Actions LTIMindtree has announced several corporate actions, including dividend payouts. Recent announcements include intimation regarding the 100 Days Campaign - 'Saksham Niveshak' on August 21, 2025, and newspaper publications regarding the Special Window for Re-lodgement of Transfer deeds of Physical Shares on August 8, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 45 per share (4500%) on April 23, 2025, which was effective from May 23, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 20 per share (2000%) announced on October 7, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 45 per share (4500%) announced on April 24, 2024. LTIMindtree has demonstrated steady revenue and net profit growth over the last five quarters.

title: Jindal Stainles, Ola Electric, MphasiS shares among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 10:00 am on Monday, Jindal Stainles, Ola Electric, MphasiS, UPL, and Oracle Fin Serv emerged as the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Jindal Stainles led the pack with a gain of 4.35%, reaching Rs 811.40. Ola Electric followed closely, rising by 4.22% to Rs 49.18. MphasiS recorded a 3.23% increase, trading at Rs 2,940.60, while UPL and Oracle Fin Serv saw gains of 3.06% and 2.6%, trading at Rs 738.35 and Rs 8,848.50, respectively. title: Infosys among top gainers on Nifty 50; share price rises 2.53%
content: In Monday's session, Infosys emerged as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50, with its share price increasing by 2.53% to Rs 1,525.10 at 10:00 am. Here is a review of Infosys's financial performance: Quarterly Financials: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown consistent growth over the recent periods. For the quarter ending June 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 40,925 Crore in March 2025. Earlier quarters also demonstrated strong figures, with Rs 41,764 Crore in December 2024, Rs 40,986 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 6,924 Crore, slightly down from Rs 7,038 Crore in March 2025, but still robust compared to Rs 6,822 Crore in December 2024, Rs 6,516 Crore in September 2024 and Rs 6,374 Crore in June 2024. title: UPL shares hit 52-week high, gain 2.24% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of UPL reached a 52-week high of Rs 740.70 on the NSE and were trading at Rs 732.50, up 2.24% in Monday's session. At 09:56 am, the stock marked a notable increase, reflecting positive investor sentiment. title: Wipro shares rise 2.15% in early trade
content: Shares of Wipro gained 2.15% in Monday's session, with the stock currently trading at Rs 253.98. The stock is performing positively in today's early trade. Financial Snapshot: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Key financial figures for Wipro reveal the consolidated quarterly performance. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 22,134.60 Crore, compared to Rs 22,504.20 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 3,331.50 Crore, while in March 2025, it was Rs 3,559.00 Crore. The EPS stood at Rs 3.18 for June 2025 and Rs 3.41 for March 2025. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 decreased from Rs 22,504.20 crore in March 2025. Net profit also saw a dip from Rs 3,559.00 crore in March 2025 to Rs 3,331.50 crore in June 2025. Consolidated Yearly Performance: Looking at the consolidated yearly performance, the revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 89,088.40 Crore, compared to Rs 89,760.30 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 13,192.60 Crore, while in March 2024, it was Rs 11,135.40 Crore. The EPS was Rs 12.56 for March 2025 and Rs 20.89 for March 2024. The revenue decreased marginally from Rs 89,760.30 crore in March 2024 to Rs 89,088.40 crore in March 2025. Net profit increased significantly from Rs 11,135.40 crore in March 2024 to Rs 13,192.60 crore in March 2025. of Rs 12.56 and a diluted EPS of Rs 12.52 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.20 and an interest coverage ratio of 14.83 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Wipro announced allotment of equity shares on August 21, 2025. The company also announced that it would acquire HARMAN's Digital Transformation Solutions (DTS) Business Unit on August 21, 2025. Wipro announced an interim dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) with an effective date of January 28, 2025. Another interim dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) was announced with an effective date of July 28, 2025. The company issued a bonus share with existing ratio of 1:1, ex-bonus date being December 3, 2024. As per Moneycontrol analysis done on 2025-08-18, sentiment for Wipro is very bearish. Shares of Wipro are currently trading at Rs 253.98, showing a positive move in today's early trade.

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,928.20 on Monday, a decline of 0.26% in the early session. Financial Performance: Bharti Airtel has demonstrated substantial financial growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has steadily increased, reaching Rs 172,985.20 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 149,982.40 Crore in the previous year. The net profit has seen a significant rise, reaching Rs 33,778.30 Crore in March 2025, a substantial increase from Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024. The consolidated quarterly revenue also reflects positive momentum, with the quarter-ending June 2025 reporting Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 47,876.20 Crore in the previous quarter. title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise marginally in early trade

Financial Snapshot: The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 26.30 in June 2025, compared to Rs 20.26 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 255,734.45 Crore, compared to Rs 221,112.91 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 109.36 in March 2025, compared to Rs 93.96 in March 2024. title: Real estate, metal stocks rise up to 5% amid rising US Fed rate cut hopes after Powell's speech
content: The shares of real estate and metal companies recorded sharp gains on August 25 as market expectations for US Federal Reserve's rate cut increased after Chair Jerome Powell's remarks at the Jackson Hole Economic Policy Symposium. The rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Realty index up nearly 1 percent to hover around 918 in the early trading hours of Monday, while Nifty Metal index rose over 1 percent to stand at 9,477, snapping a two-day losing streak. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on August 22 said that the weak job market may soon force the American central bank to cut interest rates. "Downside risks to employment are rising," according to Powell's prepared remarks at the Jackson Hole Economic Policy Symposium. He added that "the effects of tariffs on consumer prices are now clearly visible" with high uncertainty in the coming months. Most investors now expect a 25-basis-point Fed rate cut next month. "Fed chief Powell's remark at Jackson Hole that 'there is a downside risk to unemployment and shifting risk balance may warrant policy adjustment' clearly indicates a rate cut in September," said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Investments Limited. A rate cut in the US could reduce borrowing costs for foreign investors, encouraging them to invest in higher growth markets in India. This boosts real estate and metal stocks. Additionally, investors expect the RBI to follow Fed in the pursuit of a rate cut, if any. This too can positively impact the stocks. Jindal Stainless Steel was the top gainer on the Nifty Metal index, rising nearly 5 percent to trade at Rs 813.35 apiece. Hindalco Industries and National Aluminium Company (NALCO) shares gained nearly 2 percent, while NMDC, Hindustan Zinc, Vedanta and SAIL shares were up more than 1 percent each. Tata Steel, Welspun Corporation, Adani Enterprises, JSW Steel and Hindustan Copper shares rose up to 1 percent. On the realty index, Brigade Enterprises was the top gainer. The shares of the company rose over 1 percent to trade at Rs 974 apiece. Godrej Properties shares also gained more than 1 percent. DLF and Sobha shares were up nearly 1 percent each. Raymond, Prestige Estates, Macrotech Developers (Lodha), Phoenix Mills and Oberoi Realty shares were trading in the green with marginal gains. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Page Industries shares rise 2.02%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in today's trading session
content: Shares of Page Industries rose by 2.02% to Rs 46,575.00 in early trade on Monday. This increase positions the stock among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 09:47 am, the stock reflected positive momentum. Regarding the company's financial performance, Page Industries has demonstrated steady growth over the past few years.
