title: Persistent Systems shares rise 2.08% in early trade today
content: Shares of Persistent Systems were trading higher in early trade, with the stock rising 2.08% to Rs 5,480.50. The stock is trading on the Nifty Midcap 150. Persistent Systems is currently trading above its 20-day and 50-day moving averages, potentially indicating a continuation of its upward trend. Financial Performance: Persistent Systems' financial performance reveals consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Here's a detailed look: Consolidated Quarterly Performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,737.17 CroreRs 2,897.15 CroreRs 3,062.28 CroreRs 3,242.11 CroreRs 3,333.59 CroreNet ProfitRs 306.42 CroreRs 325.00 CroreRs 372.99 CroreRs 395.76 CroreRs 424.94 CroreEPS20.0921.1924.2825.6427.43The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 increased to Rs 3,333.59 Crore compared to Rs 3,242.11 Crore in March 2025. The net profit also rose to Rs 424.94 Crore in June 2025 from Rs 395.76 Crore in March 2025. Consolidated Yearly Performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 4,187.89 CroreRs 5,710.75 CroreRs 8,350.59 CroreRs 9,821.59 CroreRs 11,938.72 CroreNet ProfitRs 450.68 CroreRs 690.39 CroreRs 921.09 CroreRs 1,093.49 CroreRs 1,400.16 CroreEPS58.9790.34123.7372.4491.22BVPS365.81440.72518.82321.82405.46ROE16.1220.4923.2322.0522.15Debt to Equity0.000.130.110.040.00The annual revenue for 2025 stood at Rs 11,938.72 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 9,821.59 Crore in 2024. Similarly, the net profit for 2025 was Rs 1,400.16 Crore, up from Rs 1,093.49 Crore in the previous year. The company has consistently increased its sales from Rs 4,187 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 11,938 Crore in March 2025. Over the same period, net profit has also risen from Rs 450 Crore to Rs 1,400 Crore. Corporate Actions Persistent Systems announced several investor/analyst meets, with the latest scheduled for August 25, 2025. The company also updated regarding the 'Saksham Niveshak' campaign by the Investor's Education and Protection Fund Authority. The company has announced final dividend of Rs.15.00 per share (300%) with effective date as 14 Jul, 2025, and interim dividend of Rs.20.00 per share (400%) with effective date as 31 Jan, 2025. A stock split was announced on January 20, 2024, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5, with an ex-split date of March 28, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis on August 18, 2025, indicated a very bearish sentiment for the stock.

title: National Aluminium Company shares rise 2.19% in early trade

On August 8, 2025, the company released the video recording of the earnings conference call held on the same day. title: Divis Laboratories shares rise 2.11%, among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: shares of Divis Laboratories moved up by 2.11 percent to Rs 6281.50 in early trade. At 09:50 am, the stock is trading among the top gainers on Nifty Next 50. The company has demonstrated consistent financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,410 Crore, up from Rs 2,118 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 545 Crore, compared to Rs 430 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased to Rs 20.49 in June 2025 from Rs 16.20 in June 2024. Here is a detailed look at the company's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,118.00 CroreRs 2,338.00 CroreRs 2,319.00 CroreRs 2,585.00 CroreRs 2,410.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 430.00 CroreRs 510.00 CroreRs 589.00 CroreRs 662.00 CroreRs 545.00 CroreEPS16.2019.2022.2024.9320.49The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 9,360 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 7,845 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,191 Crore, up from Rs 1,600 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The EPS also improved to Rs 82.53 in March 2025 from Rs 60.27 in March 2024. The basic EPS was Rs 82.53 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 564.87 as of March 2025. The debt to equity ratio was 0.00 as of March 2025. Divis Laboratories announced a final dividend of Rs 30 per share on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. The company also announced a bonus issue on August 8, 2015, with an ex-bonus date of September 23, 2015, and a bonus ratio of 1:1. title: Yes Bank shares surge 2.90% amid high volume trading, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Yes Bank were trading with a gain of 2.90% at Rs 19.84 in early trade on Monday. The stock witnessed a surge in volume and is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 9:35 am. Financial Snapshot: Yes Bank's financial performance shows the following trends based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Results:Revenue: The revenue for the recent quarters has been relatively stable, with Rs 7,604 Crore in June 2025.Net Profit: The net profit has shown a positive trend, increasing from Rs 516 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 808 Crore in June 2025.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) has also increased, from Rs 0.17 in June 2024 to Rs 0.26 in June 2025.Annual Results:Revenue: The revenue has increased steadily over the years, from Rs 20,039 Crore in 2021 to Rs 30,918 Crore in 2025.Net Profit: The net profit has turned positive, increasing from a loss of Rs 3,489 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 2,447 Crore in 2025.EPS: The EPS has also improved, from Rs -1.65 in 2021 to Rs 0.79 in 2025.Income Statement (Consolidated): Here's a summary of the key figures from the consolidated income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Interest EarnedRs 30,918 CroreRs 27,605 CroreRs 22,702 CroreRs 19,018 CroreRs 20,039 CroreOther IncomeRs 6,156 CroreRs 5,355 CroreRs 4,124 CroreRs 3,404 CroreRs 3,436 CroreTotal IncomeRs 37,075 CroreRs 32,960 CroreRs 26,826 CroreRs 22,423 CroreRs 23,475 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 32,766 CroreRs 29,536 CroreRs 23,625 CroreRs 19,509 CroreRs 18,528 CroreOperating ProfitRs 4,309 CroreRs 3,424 CroreRs 3,201 CroreRs 2,913 CroreRs 4,947 CroreProvisions & ContigenciesRs 1,085 CroreRs 1,886 CroreRs 2,465 CroreRs 1,849 CroreRs 8,436 CrorePBTRs 3,223 CroreRs 1,537 CroreRs 735 CroreRs 1,064 CroreRs -3,488 CroreTaxRs 777 CroreRs 252 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,447 CroreRs 1,285 CroreRs 736 CroreRs 1,064 CroreRs -3,489 CroreThe interest earned increased by 12.00% in 2025 compared to 2024, from Rs 27,605 crore to Rs 30,918 crore. The other income also increased from Rs 5,355 crore to Rs 6,156 crore. Overall total income grew by 12.47% from Rs 32,960 crore to Rs 37,075 crore. The total expenditure also increased, however the operating profit grew to Rs 4,309 crore compared to Rs 3,424 crore in the previous year. Finally the net profit has increased significantly by 90.43% from Rs 1,285 crore to Rs 2,447 crore. title: Nifty top losers: ICICI Bank, Hero Motocorp stocks drag on Nifty 50 index in today's session
content: Shares of ICICI Bank are trading among the top losers on Nifty 50 in Monday's session. The stock was trading at Rs 1,430.40, a decline of 0.42% in today's early trade as of about 9.30 am. This decline positions it among the top losers in the Nifty 50 index during the opening session. The stock is underperforming along with overall bearish sentiments. Here's a summary of the performance of other stocks in the Nifty 50:Hero Motocorp: Rs 4,979.30 (-0.37%)Apollo Hospital: Rs 7,893.50 (-0.37%)Financial Snapshot of ICICI Bank Corporate Actions ICICI Bank has been actively involved in corporate actions, including allotment of equity shares under the Employees Stock Option Scheme. On August 19, 2025, the company allotted 626,130 equity shares with a face value of Rs. 2 each under the ICICI Bank Employees Stock Option Scheme-2000. Dividends The bank has consistently distributed dividends to its shareholders. The final dividend for 2025, announced on April 21, 2025, was Rs 11.00 per share (550%). Bonus Shares The company issued bonus shares on May 03, 2017, with an existing ratio of 10 and an offered ratio of 1. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,430.40, ICICI Bank is experiencing a slight downturn as part of Monday's trading session, reflecting broader market adjustments.

title: Positive index contributors: Bajaj Finance, TCS, Reliance stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: At 9:25 am on Monday, positive index contributors on the NIFTY 50 included Bajaj Finance, TCS, and Reliance. Top Nifty 50 Contributors:Bajaj Finance: 904.85 pointsTCS: 3104.70 pointsReliance: 1414.10 pointsTech Mahindra: 1530.00 pointsTrent: 5445.50 pointsHindalco: 710.85 pointsTitan Company: 3631.10 pointsNTPC: 340.50 pointsSBI: 817.85 pointsAsian Paints: 2517.20 pointsKotak Mahindra: 1992.60 pointsTata Steel: 159.20 pointsLarsen: 3599.00 pointsShriram Finance: 617.15 pointsTata Motors: 680.80 pointsAxis Bank: 1071.60 pointsDr Reddys Labs: 1279.20 pointsCipla: 1593.60 pointsBajaj Finance Financial Highlights: The income statement provides a detailed breakdown of annual financials. Sales increased from Rs 26,668 Crore in 2021 to Rs 69,683 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw substantial growth, rising from Rs 4,419 Crore in 2021 to Rs 16,761 Crore in 2025.Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales69,68354,96941,39731,63226,668Other Income41138714Total Income69,72454,98241,40531,64026,683Total Expenditure22,89216,95513,31912,38811,276EBIT46,83238,02628,08619,25215,406Interest24,77018,72412,5599,7489,414Tax5,3004,8584,0202,4751,572Net Profit16,76114,44311,5067,0284,419Corporate Actions: On April 29, 2025, Bajaj Finance announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 4:1, with the ex-bonus date and record date set for June 16, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on the same day, changing the face value from Rs 2 to Rs 1, also effective June 16, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 44.00 per share (2200%) and a special dividend of Rs 12.00 per share (600%) were announced with effective dates as 30 May, 2025 and 09 May, 2025 respectively. Moody's Ratings assigned Bajaj Finance a new rating of Baa3 Corporate Family Rating (CFR) with a Stable outlook, as per a press release dated August 4, 2025. TCS and Reliance also showed significant contributions to the Nifty 50, reflecting broad-based positive momentum among key market players.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise 2.01% in early trade
content: Tata Consultancy Services' stock was trading at Rs 3,115.50, marking a 2.01% increase in Monday's early trading session, as of 9:34 am. TCS stock is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Tata Consultancy Services' financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated figures:Revenue: The company's annual revenue has consistently increased over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, revenue stood at Rs 255,324 Crore, up from Rs 240,893 Crore in the year-ending March 2024.Net Profit: The net profit has also shown steady growth. The company reported a net profit of Rs 48,797 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 46,099 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) have risen from Rs 125.88 in March 2024 to Rs 134.19 in March 2025.Here is a more detailed look at the company's financial performance:HeadingMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 164,177 CroreRs 191,754 CroreRs 225,458 CroreRs 240,893 CroreRs 255,324 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562 CroreRs 38,449 CroreRs 42,303 CroreRs 46,099 CroreRs 48,797 CroreEPSRs 86.71Rs 103.62Rs 115.19Rs 125.88Rs 134.19BVPSRs 235.43Rs 245.48Rs 249.20Rs 252.26Rs 261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company has shown consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the years. Revenue increased by 6.0%, from Rs 240,893 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 255,324 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also increased by 5.85%, from Rs 46,099 Crore to Rs 48,797 Crore during the same period. Quarterly Performance: A look at the quarterly financials reveals the following:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613 CroreRs 64,259 CroreRs 63,973 CroreRs 64,479 CroreRs 63,437 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105 CroreRs 11,955 CroreRs 12,444 CroreRs 12,293 CroreRs 12,819 CroreEPSRs 33.28Rs 32.92Rs 34.21Rs 33.79Rs 35.27The company's quarterly revenue has remained relatively stable, with minor fluctuations. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 12,819 Crore, up from Rs 12,105 Crore in June 2024. Corporate Actions: Tata Consultancy Services has announced several dividends:Interim Dividend: Declared on June 27, 2025, at Rs 11.00 per share, with an effective date of July 16, 2025.Final Dividend: Declared on April 11, 2025, at Rs 30.00 per share, with an effective date of June 4, 2025.Special Dividend: Declared on January 9, 2025, at Rs 66.00 per share, with an effective date of January 17, 2025.The company also issued bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1 on three occasions: April 19, 2018 (ex-date May 31, 2018), April 20, 2009 (ex-date June 16, 2009), and April 17, 2006 (ex-date July 28, 2006). Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 20, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. Tata Consultancy Services' stock is currently trading at Rs 3,115.50, with a positive move in today's session.

title: Mazagon Dock rises 4% on buzz of Rs 70,000-cr submarine talks with Germany's Thyssenkrupp
content: Shares of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd surged 4 percent to Rs 2,799 on August 25 after CNBC TV-18 reported that the Ministry of Defence has authorised the company to open cost negotiations with Germany’s Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems for building six submarines under the Rs 70,000-crore P-75(I) programme. Talks are expected to commence shortly, with the final contract likely to be awarded to the Mazagon Dock–Thyssenkrupp consortium about six months after negotiations are concluded successfully, according to CNBC TV-18 sources. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The approval marks a key step forward in the P-75(I) deal. The two companies had already signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) in June 2023, under which Thyssenkrupp would handle engineering and design, while Mazagon Dock would undertake construction and delivery of the submarines for the Indian Navy. While the development has excited investors, analysts remain cautious. JPMorgan, in a note last week, said there was "little incremental positive newsflow" around the award of the P-75(I) contract. The brokerage has an “underweight” rating on Mazagon Dock with a price target of Rs 2,468, citing an unfavourable risk-reward equation even after the stock corrected nearly 30 percent from its peak of Rs 3,775. On July 28, the company reported a net profit of Rs 452 crore for the first quarter of the financial year 2026. This marks a decline of around 35 percent on-year from the Rs 696 crore net profit reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. Sequentially, the firm's net profit rose nearly 39 percent quarter-on-quarter from the Rs 325 crore reported in Q4 FY25. While net profit declined annually, the firm’s revenue from operations rose over than 11 percent on-year to Rs 2,626 crore in Q1 FY26. Revenue from operations however, fell more than 17 percent sequentially. At about 9:30 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 2,750, higher by 2 percent from the last close on the NSE. Mazagon Dock shares have tanked 23 percent in the last three months. However, they're still in green on a year-to-date basis, up 21 percent. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sensex rises 200 pts, Nifty nears 24,950 as Powell’s Jackson Hole speech fuels September rate cut hopes
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex were off to a flying start on Monday, August 25, after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s remarks at the Jackson Hole Symposium suggested a rate cut at the Fed’s September 16–17 meeting. At about 9:25 am, the Sensex was up 211.98 points or 0.26 percent at 81,518.83, and the Nifty was up 57.50 points or 0.23 percent at 24,927.60. About 1810 shares advanced, 1144 shares declined, and 197 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "Powell did something that no one thought he would – he went ahead and signalled that the Fed is ready to cut interest rates at their next meeting. The bar is extremely high now for the Fed to leave rates unchanged in less than a month," said market expert Ajay Bagga. He added that investors should align allocations towards risk and rate-sensitive plays—quality cyclicals, duration, and select commodities—while keeping a close eye on upcoming jobs and inflation data. "Fed chief Powell’s remark at Jackson Hole that ‘there is a downside risk to unemployment and shifting risk balance may warrant policy adjustment’ clearly indicates a rate cut in September. The US stock market gave a thumbs up to this comment, says V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments Ltd. "The positive factor may not get reflected in the Indian market as much since tariff concerns are likely to weigh more," he added. Among individual movers, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd surged 3 percent after CNBC-TV18 reported that the Ministry of Defence has cleared the company to start cost negotiations with Germany’s Thyssenkrupp Marine for building six submarines under the Rs 70,000-crore P-75(I) project. Talks are expected to begin shortly, with the contract likely to be awarded to Mazagon Dock and Thyssenkrupp around six months after successful negotiations, the report said. Also read: Tax cuts, rating upgrade lift markets — but will FIIs return, and when? Syrma SGS Technology Ltd was in the positive as the shareholder lock-in expired. According to Nuvama Alternative & Quantitative Research, 3.52 crore shares—about 20 percent of the company’s outstanding equity—became eligible for trade at the end of the one-and-a-half-year lock-in period. Technical View On the technical front, Nifty is holding on to support near 24,800. A shooting star on the weekly chart, coupled with call writing at higher levels and unwinding of puts, suggests limited upside and prolonged consolidation. Unless the index clears 25,150, upside momentum is likely to remain capped, while holding above 24,800 is critical to avoid deeper cuts. For now, analysts advise a “sell on rise” strategy, with traders watching 25,000 on the upside and 24,800 on the downside for the next decisive move. The Bank Nifty mirrors a similar setup. The index is clinging to support at 55,000 after giving up prior gains, with heightened call writing and put unwinding pointing to a fragile structure. "Holding above the 55,000 mark is critical to avoid deeper cuts, while any sustained move below it may open the door for further downside. On the upside, only a decisive reclaim above 56,150 would negate the weak bias. For now, the structure favours a ‘sell on rise’ strategy, with traders eyeing 55,000 as the key trigger zone for the next leg of directional momentum," said Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities. TCS, Tech Mahindra, Bajaj Finance, NTPC and Hindalco were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included ICICI Bank, SBI Life Insurance, Apollo Hospitals, Maruti Suzuki, and Jio Financial Services. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Unless the index clears 25,150, upside momentum is likely to remain capped, while holding above 24,800 is critical to avoid deeper cuts.
summary_luhn: For now, analysts advise a “sell on rise” strategy, with traders watching 25,000 on the upside and 24,800 on the downside for the next decisive move.
summary_lsa: Laggards on the index included ICICI Bank, SBI Life Insurance, Apollo Hospitals, Maruti Suzuki, and Jio Financial Services.
summary_textrank: For now, analysts advise a “sell on rise” strategy, with traders watching 25,000 on the upside and 24,800 on the downside for the next decisive move.

title: One 97 Communications Paytm shares rise 1.06%, hit 52-week high
content: One 97 Communications Paytm shares reached a 52-week high of Rs 1,278.60 on the NSE in early trade. At 9:16 am, the stock was trading at Rs 1,278, a gain of 1.06% from its previous close. The stock's performance is buoyed by very bullish investor sentiment, according to a Moneycontrol analysis. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of One 97 Communications Paytm:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,501.60 CroreRs 1,659.50 CroreRs 1,827.80 CroreRs 1,911.50 CroreRs 1,917.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 838.80 CroreRs 925.70 Crore-Rs 208.30 Crore-Rs 544.30 CroreRs 122.10 CroreEPS-13.0014.59-3.27-8.471.92The company's revenue has shown a consistent increase over the quarters, with the revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 standing at Rs 1,917.50 Crore. However, net profit has fluctuated, with a profit of Rs 122.10 Crore in the quarter ending June 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,790.30, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has shown a positive move in today's early session.

title: HDFC AMC stock hits all-time high on BSE in early trade, sees moderate gains
content: Shares of HDFC Asset Management Company reached an all-time high of Rs 5,873.70 on the BSE in early trade. At 09:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 5,828.00, almost flat from the previous close. Financial Highlights: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of HDFC Asset Management Company:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 775.24 CroreRs 887.21 CroreRs 934.63 CroreRs 901.36 CroreRs 968.15 CroreNet ProfitRs 603.76 CroreRs 576.61 CroreRs 641.36 CroreRs 638.46 CroreRs 747.55 CroreEPS28.2826.9930.0229.8734.95The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 968.15 Crore, compared to Rs 775.24 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 747.55 Crore, up from Rs 603.76 Crore in June 2024. The EPS increased to 34.95 in June 2025 from 28.28 in June 2024. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance of HDFC Asset Management Company:Heading202320242025RevenueRs 2,166.81 CroreRs 2,584.37 CroreRs 3,498.44 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,423.37 CroreRs 1,942.69 CroreRs 2,460.19 CroreEPS66.7291.00115.16BVPS286.19331.41380.26ROE23.3027.4530.26Debt to Equity0.000.000.00The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 3,498.44 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 2,584.37 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also rose to Rs 2,460.19 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,942.69 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 91.00 in 2024 to Rs 115.16 in 2025. title: Maruti Suzuki India stock hits all-time high on NSE in opening session, trades with modest gains
content: Maruti Suzuki India reached an all-time high of Rs 14,425.00 on the NSE in Monday's opening trade. At 9:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 14,349.00, with a marginal gain from the previous close. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 38,605.20 Crore, compared to Rs 40,920.10 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 35,779.40 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 3,756.90 Crore, compared to Rs 3,839.20 Crore in the previous quarter and Rs 3,702.10 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 120.62, compared to Rs 124.40 in the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 119.58 in the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 152,913.00 Crore, compared to Rs 141,858.20 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 14,256.30 Crore, compared to Rs 13,234.10 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 461.20, compared to Rs 429.01 in the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios for Maruti Suzuki India show a P/E ratio of 24.98 and a P/B ratio of 3.76 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025.Maruti Suzuki India Financial DataParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 70,372.00 CroreRs 88,329.80 CroreRs 117,571.30 CroreRs 141,858.20 CroreRs 152,913.00 CroreOther IncomeRs 2,936 CroreRs 1,744 CroreRs 2,140 CroreRs 4,093 CroreRs 5,022 CroreTotal IncomeRs 73,308 CroreRs 90,074 CroreRs 119,712 CroreRs 145,951 CroreRs 157,935 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 68,054 CroreRs 85,412 CroreRs 109,379 CroreRs 128,587 CroreRs 138,364 CroreEBITRs 5,253 CroreRs 4,661 CroreRs 10,332 CroreRs 17,364 CroreRs 19,570 CroreInterestRs 101 CroreRs 126 CroreRs 187 CroreRs 193 CroreRs 194 CroreTaxRs 931 CroreRs 817 CroreRs 2,112 CroreRs 3,936 CroreRs 5,119 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,220 CroreRs 3,717 CroreRs 8,033 CroreRs 13,234 CroreRs 14,256 CroreThe annual sales for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 152,913 Crore compared to Rs 141,858 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit also increased to Rs 14,256 Crore in the year-ending March 2025 from Rs 13,234 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 135.00 per share on April 25, 2025, with an effective date of August 1, 2025. Previously, a final dividend of Rs 125.00 per share was announced on April 26, 2024, with an effective date of August 2, 2024. According to Moneycontrol analysis as of August 25, 2025, the sentiment for Maruti Suzuki India is very bullish. Maruti Suzuki has hit an all time high of Rs 14,425.00 on NSE.
